Changed close buttons to use the "X" icon, instead of a String.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1008 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

<?xml version="1.0"?>

<!DOCTYPE project [
  <!ENTITY build-common SYSTEM "file:../build-common.xml">
]>

<!--
  $Id: build.xml,v 1.45 2002/08/02 23:42:38 theoyaung Exp $
-->
<project name="drjava" default="test">
  <!-- srcroot is the base directory of the source, 4 packages back -->
  <property name="srcroot" value="${basedir}/../../../.." />

  <!-- built is where the compiled classes go -->
  <property name="built" value="${srcroot}/../built/" />

  <!-- dist is where the packaged jars go -->
  <property name="dist" value="${srcroot}/../dist/" />

  <!-- projpath is the path from srcroot to the root directory of this project
  -->
  <property name="projpath" value="edu/rice/cs/${ant.project.name}" />

  <!-- put a jar in this directory after each commit -->
  <property name="jars_dir" value="/home/javaplt/public_html/drjava/builds" />

  <!-- put new javadoc in this directory after each commit -->
  <property name="public_javadoc_dir" value="/home/javaplt/public_html/javadoc/${ant.project.name}" />

  <!-- put javadoc in this directory if generating private javadoc -->
  <property name="private_javadoc_dir" value="${srcroot}/../javadoc/${ant.project.name}" />

  <!-- put documentation html in this directory -->
  <property name="doc_dir" value="${built}/edu/rice/cs/drjava/docs" />

  <property name="osxtag" value="drjava-osx" />
  <property name="osxdir" value="${srcroot}/../" />
  <property name="jarfile" value="${srcroot}/../drjava.jar" />
  <property name="manifest" value="manifest" />


  <!-- Sets a flag indicating that code dealing with new features since the
    last stable release should be enabled and testable.
    Takes effect only after a clean compile -->
  <target name="development">
    <filter token="DEVELOPMENT" value = "true" />
    <copy file="CodeStatus.orig"
          tofile="CodeStatus.java"
          overwrite="yes"
          filtering="yes" />
  </target>

  <!-- Sets a flag indicating that code dealing with new features since the
    last stable release should not be enabled or testable.
    Takes effect only after a clean compile -->
  <target name="stable">
    <filter token="DEVELOPMENT" value = "false" />
    <copy file="CodeStatus.orig"
          tofile="CodeStatus.java"
          overwrite="yes"
          filtering="yes" />
  </target>


  <!-- include standard build file parts -->
  &build-common;

  <!-- generate jar and javadoc
       Requires version-tag to be set (via command line -Dversion-tag=)
       For example, to release drjava-20020101-0000, you'd type:

       ant -Dversion-tag=drjava-20020101-0000 release
  -->
  <target name="release" if="version-tag" depends="update,compile">
    <delete dir="${dist}/${version-tag}" />
    <mkdir dir="${dist}/${version-tag}" />

    <!-- generate javadoc for the committed version! -->
    <antcall target="generate_javadoc">
      <param name="javadoc_dir" value="${dist}/${version-tag}/javadoc" />
      <param name="javadoc_title" value="${version-tag}" />
    </antcall>

    <zip zipfile="${dist}/${version-tag}-javadoc.zip">
      <fileset dir="${dist}">
        <include name="${version-tag}/javadoc/**" />
      </fileset>
    </zip>

    <delete dir="${dist}/${version-tag}/javadoc" />

    <cvs dest="${dist}/${version-tag}"
         tag="HEAD"
         quiet="yes"
         package="src/edu/rice/cs/drjava"
         command="export -N" />

    <cvs dest="${dist}/${version-tag}"
         tag="HEAD"
         quiet="yes"
         package="src/edu/rice/cs/util"
         command="export -N" />

    <cvs dest="${dist}/${version-tag}"
         tag="HEAD"
         quiet="yes"
         package="src/edu/rice/cs/lib"
         command="export -N" />

    <zip zipfile="${dist}/${version-tag}-src.zip">
      <fileset dir="${dist}">
        <include name="${version-tag}/src/**" />
      </fileset>
    </zip>

    <delete dir="${dist}/${version-tag}" />

    <antcall target="docs" />

    <antcall target="osxapp">
      <param name="osxdir" value="${dist}" />
      <param name="osxtag" value="${version-tag}-osx" />
    </antcall>

    <antcall target="jar">
      <param name="jarfile" value="${dist}/${version-tag}.jar" />
    </antcall>
  </target>

  <target name="compile" depends="do-compile">
    <rmic base="${built}"
          classname="edu.rice.cs.drjava.model.repl.newjvm.InterpreterJVM" />

    <rmic base="${built}"
          classname="edu.rice.cs.drjava.model.repl.newjvm.MainJVM" />

    <copy todir="${built}">
      <fileset dir="${srcroot}">
        <!-- include the GPL -->
        <include name="edu/rice/cs/LICENSE" />

        <!-- include graphics -->
        <include name="${projpath}/**/LICENSE" />
        <include name="${projpath}/**/*.gif" />
      </fileset>
    </copy>

  </target>

  <target name="osxapp" depends="jar">
    <mkdir dir="${osxdir}/${osxtag}/DrJava.app" />
    <copy todir="${osxdir}/${osxtag}/DrJava.app/">
      <fileset dir="${basedir}/packaging/DrJava.app"
        excludes="Contents/Resources/Java/DrJava.jar-goes-here" />
    </copy>

    <copy file="${jarfile}" tofile="${osxdir}/${osxtag}/DrJava.app/Contents/Resources/Java/DrJava.jar" />

    <tar tarfile="${osxdir}/${osxtag}.tar">
      <tarfileset dir="${osxdir}/">
        <include name="${osxtag}/**/*" />
        <exclude name="${osxtag}/DrJava.app/Contents/MacOS/DrJava" />
      </tarfileset>
      <tarfileset dir="${osxdir}/" mode="755">
        <include name="${osxtag}/DrJava.app/Contents/MacOS/DrJava" />
      </tarfileset>
    </tar>
    <gzip src="${osxdir}/${osxtag}.tar"
      zipfile="${osxdir}/${osxtag}.tar.gz" />

    <delete dir="${osxdir}/${osxtag}" />
    <delete file="${osxdir}/${osxtag}.tar" />
  </target>

  <!-- Makes a jar with dependencies. No tests are included. -->
  <target name="jar">
    <!-- copy external dependencies -->
    <zip zipfile="${jarfile}">
      <zipfileset src="${lib_dir}/gj-util.jar" />
      <zipfileset src="${lib_dir}/dynamicjava.jar" />
      <zipfileset src="${lib_dir}/junit.jar" />
    </zip>

    <jar jarfile="${jarfile}" manifest="${manifest}" update="true" >
      <fileset dir="${built}" excludes="**/*Test.class">
        <include name="${projpath}/**" />
        <include name="edu/rice/cs/util/**" />

        <!-- include the GPL -->
        <include name="edu/rice/cs/LICENSE" />
      </fileset>
    </jar>
  </target>

  <!-- Run the program! -->
  <target name="run" depends="compile">
    <java fork="true" classname="edu.rice.cs.drjava.DrJava">
      <classpath refid="classpath" />
    </java>
  </target>


  <!-- Check if docbook2html is available -->
  <target name="docbook-present">
    <property environment="env"/>
    <available file="docbook2html" property="docbook.present">
      <filepath>
        <pathelement path="${env.PATH}" />
      </filepath>
    </available>
  </target>

  <!-- Create documentation html -->
  <target name="docs" depends="userdocs" unless="docbook.present">
    <echo message="Could not find docbook2html.  Not generating docs." />
  </target>

  <!-- Create the user documentation -->
  <target name="userdocs" depends="docbook-present" if="docbook.present">
    <delete dir="${doc_dir}/user/" />
    <mkdir dir="${doc_dir}/user/" />
    <echo message="Creating documentation HTML..." />
    <apply executable="docbook2html" failonerror="yes" type="file">
      <arg value="-o"/>
      <arg value="${doc_dir}/user/"/>
      <fileset dir="${srcroot}/${projpath}/docs/user">
        <include name="userdoc.docbook" />
      </fileset>
    </apply>
  </target>

  <!-- Allow a commit of just the docs, without testing -->
  <target name="commit-docs">
    <echo message="Committing the documentation." />
    <cvs command="commit docs" />
  </target>

</project>


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1010 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Updated HighlightManager to be able to refresh an existing highlight
with a new highlight painter.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1011 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Updated documentation for the release.
Revert now updates classFileInSync status.
Compile All now works if untitled documents are open.
Closing compiler or test output tabs now resets corresponding error state.
Highlight colors on the compiler and test output tabs are now configurable.
Compiler errors now show the line number.
Fixed setCurrentDirectory in MainFrame, which caused an exception in
  Windows with relative paths.  (Also, setting working directory now
  live updates the current directory.)
Removed threadLocationHighlight when resuming the thread.
Added file filters to file option components in ConfigFrame.
Fixed scrolling problems with ConfigPanel.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1013 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Updated README to mention including tools.jar on classpath.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1015 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Fixed "import.junit" to "import junit" in the JUnit chapter.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1016 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Committing in some minor UI layout changes.  Changed Save Interactions History to prompt before showing the editor, and then to show a modal dialog for the editor.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1017 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Implemented safe-guards against ever attempting to read any file from disk,
 being sure always to check that the file still exists in its designated
 location. If it does not, throws a FileMovedException indicating that the file
 must have been moved or deleted.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1019 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Simply added the FileMovedException for the previously reported changes.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1020 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

The test button now calls compile all instead of compile current document
in order to make sure that non-public classes defined in other classes are
compiled and also prevents the current document from being re-compiled if it
is not necessary.

The compile, compile all, and test functions are all synchronized now so that
multiple threads cannot access the compiler simultaneously.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1021 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

The sourceRootSet now puts the current directory (directory DrJava was run
from) after the source roots of the currently open documents so that the
source files the user is looking at correspond to the class files that the
interpreter is using.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1023 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Removed the current directory from automatically being on the classpath

- Changed the restartInterpreterJVM method in MainJVM to fix threading issues

- Changed the default color of numbers

- Fixed preferences menu bug where it could not be exited if the .drjava
  file could not be written to


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1024 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added documentation for file types on Windows,
Changed HelpFrame to make sure that the help browser never shows the Table of Contents in the main window.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1025 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added the number of errors to the Compiler Output tab, and fixed it
so that switching away from the Interactions Pane and back before
using it puts the caret in the right place.  Also removed a println
in JavacGJCompiler and applied the main font to History Save Dialog.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1027 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added hook for prototype custom classloader (DrJavaClassLoader).  It currently is disabled, as it breaks a significant portion of DrJava, however hopefully it will be worked on some more.

Changed some GUI layout, in Find/Replace, PrintPreview, JUnit, and UncaughtExceptions.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1029 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Finally tracked down the brace-matching bug in the reduced model:
  when trying to insert a brace into a gap in the reduced brace model, the
  coded logic would try to split the gap at the appropriate offset and insert
  the brace. Our problem was being caused when we inserted a brace next to an
  existing brace, which made the "insertion offset" into the gap following the
  existing brace equal to 0. When the method insertBraceToGap() (which always
  inserts before a token)  attempted to shrink the gap by this insertion
  offset, then insert a Brace, followed by a new Gap of size 0! This gap did
  nothing but confuse our brace-matching -- since it had no size associated
  with it, it appeared to be right where our brace token was, and hence, when
  inserted before the end node of any document, any number of sequential,
  nested braces without intervening gaps  would actually lose highlighting
  when retraversed.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1031 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed some issues with repeated calls to reset interactions by making the
call more thread safe. There is now an interactionsResetting state in which the
reset button is disabled and the interactions pane is made uneditable and an
interactionsReady state in which those changed are undone.
- Added a timer which will warn the user if a new interpreter JVM cannot be
connected to. It will stop retrying after a set number of attempts.
- Optimized GlobalModelCompileTest by removing redundant tests.
- Updated all GlobalModel tests to work with the new version of reset
interactions.
- In DebugManager, changed all watch values to be Strings instead of Objects
because upon refreshing the watch values, a jdi class was polled to get its
value, but now the String-form of the value is kept.
- Undo and redo always cause a file's modified flag to be set to true.
- UndoWithPosition and OurUndoManager were added to DefinitionsPane to
allow for setting the caret to the correct place after an undo or redo. It
seems like there should be a way to get a Position from an UndoableEdit, but
there isn't one that we could find, so we had to keep track of our own
bookkeeping.
- Shift-Enter will insert a new line while editing the interactions pane.
This allows typing cleaner multi-line statements.
- Fixed bug where clicking on the cut/copy/paste toolbar buttons while
in the interactions pane would shift focus to the definitions pane.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1033 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added the TypeCheckerExtension class to override the visit DivideExpression
and RemainderExpressions in Dynamic Java's TypeChecker. This fixes the short-
circuiting bug.

- Fixed watches.

- Fixed getClassname in DefinitionsDocument.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1034 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Committing the stable version in preparation for the stable release.
 - Added a test to cover the DefDoc.getClassname() bug (fixed)
 - Fixed number and character color defaults
 - Updated several sections of the documentation
 - Improved cleanup of breakpoints if debugger exits uncleanly
 - Began work on forward brace matching, but not currently in use
 - Made sure caret is visible when clicking on highlighted errors
 - Fixed keybinding bug where some events happened twice
   (needed to consume the event in DefPane)
 - Fixed the JUnit Stack Trace Popup Menu, which wasn't working
 - Disabled the Debug Mode menu item when Interactions Pane is resetting


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1036 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Moved JUnit to the InterpreterJVM
  - added JUnitTestManager which handles the actual testing in the
    InterpreterJVM
  - made JUnitError serializable
  - changed GlobalModelJUnitTest
  - InterpreterJVM now maintains the current classpath

- Puts the current document first in the list of sourceroots.

- Testing no longer requires that the file first be saved and compiled
  This allows tests to be debugged.

- While testing, a message is displayed if the tested document is out of
  sync.

- Improved watches.

- Fixed bug when attempting to scroll to or highlight a line in a source file
  that is out of the bound of the document.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1038 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- DrJava now prompts before quitting (can be disabled)
 - Interactions exited message can now be disabled
 - Started improving documentation in DefaultGlobalModel and MainFrame
 - Now prints a message when the interactions pane is resetting
   (need to fix this so it isn't printed on startup)
 - Now resets the JUnit error models after a compile
 - Added a test to ensure renamed files are out of sync w/ class file
 - Fixed bug in Interactions document where the caret would always jump
   to the end of the document after a reset, even if inserting text in
   the middle of a command.  (Needed to set inProgress flag to false.)
 - JUnit panel now displays the number of test failures
 - Started work on a new home key action in MainFrame (unfinished)
 - Moved more ModelListener methods in MainFrame to the event-dispatching
   thread w/ SwingUtilities.invokeLater()
   (This includes the interactions reset message, fixing bug 597966)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1040 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Reinstated the sticky class loader so jars on the extra.classpath can
   be accessed by user-defined classes in the Interactions pane.
 - Changed the debugger to keep track of a list of EventRequests for
   each DebugAction, rather than just one.  This is necessary because
   multiple copies of each class can be loaded (from the sticky class
   loader), so breakpoints must be set and removed on all copies.
   This also allows the debugger to work effectively on JUnit tests,
   which use a reloading class loader.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1042 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added a test to ensure bug 599304 is not repeated-- user-defined
classes must be able to extend classes on extra.classpath and be
used in the Interactions pane.  (Essentially, requires the
sticky class loader in DynamicJavaAdapter.)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1044 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added a "-config [FILE]" command line argument to specify a custom
   configuration file.  This involved making the config object a
   non-final static field on DrJava and giving it an accessor method
   instead of accessing it directly.  (DrJava.getConfig() instead of
   DrJava.CONFIG.)  Also added a "-help" option to display a usage
   message, and a ConfigFileTest to cover the new option.
   (ConfigurationTool is no longer necessary-- it only has comments
   at the moment.)

 - Added configurable support for the assert keyword in Java 1.4.
   Enabling the option on the Misc panel of the Preferences window
   allows files with asserts to be compiled (if the compiler supports
   the option), and the Interactions JVM will execute assertions in
   user-defined methods, but not if directly entered.  (DynamicJava
   can't parse them.)

 - Changed compile tests to fail if the compile fails unexpectedly.
   Before, it would hang (waits but is never notified).

 - Allowed SingleDisplayModelTest to share Interactions JVMs, just
   like the other GlobalModel*Tests.

 - Improved comments in DrJava.java

 - Reindented OptionMapLoader.

 - The config object is now reset at the beginning of every test.

 - Gave CompilerErrorModel a toString.

 - Added a null pointer check to DebugManager

 - MainFrame now updates the error listeners when a test starts.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1046 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- The interactionsResetting and interactionsReset events are no longer
   fired on startup, since they were redundant (and sometimes caused two
   blinking carets to appear).

 - Improved RMI support.  Each copy of DrJava now keeps its own RMI registry
   (so that an old one can't quit and destroy the registry being used by
   new copies), which runs on a safely determined port.  Also connects to
   127.0.0.1 instead of the machine's own notion of its IP address, which
   seemed to have caused problems on some machines.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1048 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed another RMI issue so that all copies of DrJava run on their own
   unique RMI port.  This way no copy can be crippled when another copy
   (or an existing RMI registry) quits.  The only exception is during the
   test cases, which all share an RMI registry on the default port (1099).
   The only reason this is necessary is that Java does not seem to be able
   to create more than one RMI registry (using LocateRegistry.createRegistry)
   in the same JVM, and there's no way to communicate the current unique
   port across different test case classes (even in a static field, since
   each test class is loaded with a class loader).

 - Updated Dependencies test to reflect the current util version.
   (long overdue)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1050 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Resolved the locale-specific key binding bugs (604459 and 603414),
by always outputting ctrl, alt, meta, and shift in English.

Made sure the UncaughtExceptionWindow is displayed even if there
is an exception in initializing DrJava.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1052 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added a test to ensure keybindings are formatted properly in
   foreign locales.

 - Changed "Interactions Classpath" to "Extra Classpath" in the
   Preferences and documentation, and added the "-config" option
   to the documentation.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1054 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added missing javadoc package pages, improved javadoc of existing packages.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1056 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Changed getClassName() to getFirstTopLevelClassName() in DefDoc, since
it does not take inner or non public classes into account.

Added getEnclosingTopLevelClassName() to DefDoc, which is needed by
the debugger to find the outermost non public class when setting
breakpoints.  (Added appropriate tests as well.)  The debugger can
now set breakpoints in non public classes, but cannot yet step
into them.

Also refactored the DebugTest (abstracted the test listeners).


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1057 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

The debugger now uses ReferenceType.sourceName() to find the name
of the source file when stepping, which resolved the problem of
trying to find source files for non-public classes.  The debugger
can now handle non-public classes without a problem.

Also fixed testStepInto in DebugTest, which was incorrectly counting
the number of times threadLocationUpdated was being fired.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1059 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Adding a source tree for classes which can only be compiled
using the JSR-14 v1.0 compiler.  This includes compiler adapters
for Java 1.3, Java 1.4.0, and JSR-14 v1.0.

These classes do not usually need to be compiled when building
DrJava-- instead, they are stored in compilers-jsr14v1_0.jar
in the lib directory.  If changes are made, these classes can
be recompiled (and put into the jar) using "ant compile-jsr14v1_0".

See the readme.txt for more details.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1061 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Adding a source tree for classes which can only be compiled
using the JSR-14 v1.2 compiler.  This will include compiler adapters
for Java 1.4.1 and JSR-14 v1.2.

These classes do not usually need to be compiled when building
DrJava-- instead, they are stored in compilers-jsr14v1_2.jar
in the lib directory.  If changes are made, these classes can
be recompiled (and put into the jar) using "ant compile-jsr14v1_2".

See the readme.txt for more details.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1062 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

This file contains pre-compiled classes for the compiler adapters
which require JSR-14 v1.0.  See src/src-jsr14v1_0/readme.txt for
more details.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1063 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Updated readme to mention the requirement for Ant 1.5, and
added instructions on how to compile.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1064 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added the "-gj" switch to the "compile" target, so that JSR-14 v1.2
will work.  This means we now require Ant 1.5, since Ant 1.4.1 and
earlier did not support the <compilerarg> tag.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1065 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

This commit is mainly infrastructure changes which were necessary to
start supporting JSR-14 v1.2 and Java 1.4.1, which have a different
compiler interface.

There are now new source trees at the root level for classes which
can only be compiled with JSR-14 v1.0 or JSR-14 v1.2, which includes
many of the compiler adapters.  In this commit, JavacGJCompiler and
JSR14Compiler have been moved to the src/src-jsr14v1_0/ source tree,
and their pre-compiled classes have been added to compilers-jsr14v1_0.jar
in the lib directory, which should be added to your classpath.

With this commit, DrJava can now be compiled with either JSR-14 v1.0
or JSR-14 v1.2.  However, integrated support for the v1.2 compiler
within DrJava (via a compiler adapter) has not been added yet.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1066 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Committing the initial versions of the Java 1.4.1+ and JSR-14 v1.2+
compiler adapters.  These reside in their own source tree, since they
cannot be compiled with the JSR-14 v1.0 compiler.  These classes are
pre-compiled and stored in the compilers-jsr14v1_2.jar file in the
edu/rice/cs/lib/ directory, which should be put on your classpath.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1068 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

This file contains pre-compiled class files for the classes in the
src/src-jsr14v1_2/ directory, which can only be compiled with the
JSR-14 v1.2 (or later) compiler.  The class files do not need to
be recompiled when building DrJava, but this jar file should be put
on your classpath.  To rebuild this file after modifying the classes,
run the "ant compile-jsr14v1_2" target.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1069 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added compiler adapters for Java 1.4.1+ and JSR-14 v1.2+ to the
   JSR-14 v1.2 specific source tree, as well as a compilers-jsr14v1_2.jar
   file to the lib directory.  These adapters do not need to be compiled
   when DrJava is compiled, but do need to be on the classpath.

 - Fixed a timing bug in GlobalModelJUnitTest, where one test case wasn't
   waiting until its test finished, so the corresponding events occurred
   during the next test case, throwing things off.

 - Fixed a bug with the debugger's stepping mechanism which prevented it
   from highlighting the source of files in packages.  Also removed the
   testStartupAndShutdown method, which was repeating checks in other
   tests and which was occasionally causing a ConnectException.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1070 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Strings and characters are now quoted in the Interactions pane
   if they are at the top level.  (eg. "s" instead of s)

 - Fixed a bug which prevented the Interactions prompt from returning
   if the user's toString method threw an exception.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1072 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated release target to clean and include correct packages in
   src distribution.

 - Added a check for the wrong version of JPDA jar.

 - Added a "workaround" for the fact that new frames and dialogs
   appear *behind* DrJava (only on Windows).  The workaround involves
   briefly opening a JDialog and closing it again when the Interpreter
   JVM is created, and only occurs on Windows.  The dialog is barely
   noticeable.

 - Abstracted MainFrame's quit behavior so it also happens if the user
   clicks the window's close button.

 - Finally moved JUnitErrorCaretListener to the ui package.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1074 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Discovered that two DefinitionsDocuments were being created for each open
   and each new.  One was created by the EditorKit when the DefPane was
   created (because of the JEditorPane constructor, which refuses to take in
   an existing document), and one was created by the model and actually used.
   Changed the EditorKit to return a PlainDocument instead, which is less
   expensive to throw away-- see the comment in DefinitionsEditorKit for a
   full explanation of why a better solution isn't possible.

 - Removed all calls to reduced.absOffset() in the indent helper methods of
   DefinitionsDocument, since that walked back to the start of the document
   every time.  (This caused indenting blocks to be quadratic in the length
   of the document.)

 - Added a cache for results from the helper methods in DefinitionsDocument
   to improve the performance of the indent framework.  Any time a call to
   a helper method is repeated with the same arguments, the cached result
   can be returned.  This cache is cleared every time the document is changed.

   (This can probably be improved by returning cached results in certain cases
   where we know the answer is the same even if the inputs are not identical,
   such as finding a brace, etc.  The cache could also be used for results from
   calls directly to the reduced model.)

 - Changed the cutoff for the Indent lines warning from 2000 to 10000
   characters, based on the increase in speed.  (It's over twice as fast.)
   Ideally we'll be able to get rid of this warning, but it's still pretty
   bad over 1000 lines.

 - Started prototyping a progress bar for the JUnit test framework.  Currently
   commented out, but can display a red/green bar in a new frame for tests.

 - Increased the undo limit on a document from 100 to 1000.

 - Prevented a NullPointerException in MainFrame for cut/copy/paste


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1076 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- DefinitionsDocument now caches the IndentInfo object.

 - Added debugging statements to help track down slow helper methods
   in DefDoc (currently commented out).

 - Fixed setTab to only adjust by difference of amount for indent,
   rather than always removing the old prefix and inserting the new one.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1078 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Changed some of the helper methods in DefinitionsDocument to improve
performance:  instead of moving the reduced model to a position of interest
and back several times in a loop, it now moves the reduced model in one
direction only, putting it back at the end.  (Prevents potentially
quadratic behavior.)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1080 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added a size limit to the helper method cache in DefinitionsDocument.
   It now bounds the size at 10000 elements, which should be large enough
   to still work well on large documents but not grow unbounded.  (It only
   reaches the maximum size on very large indents without the document
   being changed, anyway.)  Removes the oldest elements from the cache.

 - Added "Indent Line(s)" to the Edit menu.  No configurable key yet.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1082 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

The compiler output and test output tabs now allow their text
to be selected and copied, and don't highlight errors when any
text is selected.  This allows copying and pasting (eg. into an
email or to be printed).


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1084 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added more JUnit methods on the GlobalModel listener to allow the creation
   of a progress bar in the view while tests are running.  The names of the
   tests currently being run and their results are passed to each listener,
   but the names are not currently displayed-- just the progress bar.
   Also removed the junitRunning() event, which is no longer needed.
   Note: it's becoming necessary to decompose the GlobalModelListener...

 - Updated the MainJVM / InterpreterJVM interface to support the new
   JUnit status methods.

 - Updated the GlobalModelJUnitTest to reflect the new listener interface.

 - Changed the compiler error and test error highlights to only be displayed
   if their respective tabs are visible.  This partially involved keeping
   track of the error and test highlights separately in DefPane, but because
   of the change to tabs, only one of these highlights will ever be displayed.

 - Changed the compiler and test tabs to allow text to be selected and copied.
   This involves hiding the error highlight if a selection is present.

 - Prevented "Last compiliation completed successfully" from being displayed
   in the compiler tab until a compile actually occurs.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1086 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Updated the message in the CompilerErrorPanel to display the name
of the compiler that is ready until a compile actually occurs.
If no compiler is available, a different message is displayed.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1088 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Prevented the _activeCompiler field in CompilerRegistry from being
assigned a null value.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1090 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Prevented InvocationException from being thrown when creating the
debugger-- any Throwable is now caught.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1092 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Included compilers-jsr14v1_2.jar in list of jars to be put on the classpath.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1094 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed bug 634836, in which Compile All did not always compile
   all of the documents.  Before, we checked to see if a document was in
   sync with its class file before compiling it (to improve performance).
   This does not detect if dependencies have changed, though, so the
   performance optimization was removed.

 - Added a small delay after each print call to System.out or System.err,
   so that infinite print loops cannot flood the Main JVM to the point
   that the UI becomes completely unresponsive.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1095 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Improved the GUI layout of the preferences frame.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1097 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Included classpath on compile task, so users don't have to in their
environment.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1099 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed bug 635982 ("moved file dialog default"), where a FileMovedException
   would break Save All, causing it to save only the file that had been moved,
   but displaying the wrong filename by default in the file chooser.
   Instead of propagating the exception, it is now caught and a new method,
   shouldSaveAfterFileMoved(), has been added to FileSaveSelector, so that
   the UI can cleanly prompt the user whether to save as a new file.
   Updated GlobalModelIOTest to reflect this.

 - Updated the User Documentation with everything since the stable release.

 - Cleaned up the implementation of the command-line-driven IndentFiles
   class and included it in the documentation.

 - Started improving documentation for the Indent decision tree to start
   looking for the known bugs.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1100 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Refactored the DebugManager to now be JPDADebugger, implementing a
Debugger interface.  This allows us to have a NoDebuggerAvailable
implementation, rather than using null as a value.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1102 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Fixed the new Debugger refactoring to actually stop checking for null,
and instead use a new isAvailable() method on the Debugger.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1104 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Committing a stable version for a beta release.  Also updated a few
package.html pages.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1106 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Fixed the JSR14v12 adapter to work with JSR14 v1.3.  This involved
using reflection to look for a method which had been added in 1.3,
so that we can know whether to use "-gj" or "-source 1.5" as the
command line argument to enable generics.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1108 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Modified TokenList to compile with JSR14v1.3.  It had an inner class
extending an inner class of ModelList of the same name, which was actually
illegal but a bug in the older Java compilers allowed it to pass.
A strange sequence of casts allows us to get by without changing the
class name (as suggested by Neal Gafter, Neal.Gafter@sun.com).

The JSR-14 v1.2 compiler adapter was also updated to work with v1.3
by determining which version is running and passing the appropriate
command line argument.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1109 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Updated the compilers-jsr14v1_2.jar file to support JSR-14 v1.3.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1111 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Fixed GlobalModelIOTest to pass on Windows (in Cygwin), involving
using System.getProperty("line.separator") and trim().  The
loadHistory() method in DefaultGlobalModel was also updated to
close its file reader.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1112 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added the classpath property to the rmic compile commands.
(Not urgent.)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1114 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Committing the stable version for a release.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1115 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added first revision of developer documentation, including the intro
and instructions on how to set up a build environment.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1117 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added developer documentation to the "ant docs" build target.

   protected and should only be called in tests.

   file based solution, eliminating the need for an RMI Registry.
   This solves the problem several people have encountered with
   not being able to reset the interactions pane.

 - Adjusted GlobalModelCompileTest, GlobalModelJUnitTest, DebugTest, and
   GlobalModelOtherTest to pass on Windows.  (Involved lengthening the delay
   for class file synchronization checks and waiting for interaction results
   where appropriate.

Updated AbstractMasterJVM and SlaveJVMRunner to use 127.0.0.1 as the IP address for all RMI calls, rather than any real IP address.  This way, if the user leaves the network or changes IP addresses, DrJava can still function.  Fixes bug 676558.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1145 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Abstracted doCompile and several helper methods from DebugTest and GlobalModelOtherTest to GlobalModelTestCase.  Improved the interpreter listener in DebugTest.  Made InterpreterJVM.interpret(s) run in its own thread, so we don't have to wait for the RMI thread to be clean up when waiting for the ThreadDied event.  Speeds things up in the debugger and simplifies stack traces.  (Accordingly, removed the new thread creation in MainJVM.interpret(s).)

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1177 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Refactored InteractionsDocument to more easily support using it in a
   standalone context.  Made it an interface, with most of the
   functionality in AbstractInteractionsDocument.
   DefaultInteractionsDocument knows how to interpret using
   DefaultGlobalModel's interpreter (through MainJVM), while
   SimpleInteractionsDocument runs an interpreter in the same JVM (useful
   for a standalone app).  InteractionsPane no longer needs a GlobalModel,
   but just an InteractionsDocument.  (Makes testing much easier.)

 - Added SimpleInteractionsWindow as a standalone application, partly as a
   prototype for external plugins (like Eclipse), and partly as a useful
   tool for quick and dirty experimentation.  Runs in a single JVM, so you
   can get yourself into trouble easily.

 - First small changes on trying to fix some of the horrid memory problems
   in the tests.  Currently *everything* is staying around, due to
   references to DrJava from the static config framework listeners and
   various other static fields.  (In other words, DrJava is one huge
   memory leak, but we don't care in practice-- just in the tests when
   there are dozens of copies of it from different classloaders.)  This
   isn't going to be easy to fix...


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1179 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Resolving bugs 681547 and 681552.  The interactions pane completely ceased
   to interpret any input after the refactoring changes.  This was a result of
   installing the InteractionsEditorKit after creating the InteractionsPane,
   since it apparently forces the pane to create a new document immediately,
   giving the pane and the model two different documents.  We now ignore the
   InteractionsEditorKit, since the pane will only ever have one document
   anyway.

 - Added a test to ensure this bug doesn't come back:
   edu.rice.cs.drjava.ui.MainFrameTest.testCorrectInteractionsDocument

- Made ToolsJarClassLoader more flexible by adding utility methods for
   obtaining guesses for the location of tools.jar as both an array of
   Files and a classpath-formatted string.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1191 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated DependenciesTest to require the new ToolsJarClassLoader in util.

 - Implemented feature 682602 ("Always make debugger available").
   DrJava.java now checks to see if the JDI classes can be loaded before
   starting the MainFrame, or if it can locate them through a classloader.
   If necessary, it uses ExecJVM to restart with tools.jar on the
   classpath.  Accordingly, removed all of the DrJavaClassLoader stuff.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1193 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Improved ToolsJarClassLoader's heuristic for finding tools.jar on
   Windows.  Since Windows sets JAVA_HOME to the JRE and not the SDK, we
   have to make an educated guess as to the location of the SDK.  If the
   user has installed in in the default location (C:\j2sdk...), we will
   now be able to find it automatically.  ToolsJarClassLoaderTest checks
   the parsing methods for this functionality.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1195 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated DependenciesTest to require the improved tools.jar-finding
   heuristic on Windows in ToolsJarClassLoader.

 - Fixed the message on the Compiler Tab if no compiler is available.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1197 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- New Features Added:
    Comment Line(s) - Adds wing comments "// " to the beginning of all selected
      lines (including lines only partially selected), or the current line, if
      there is no selection.
    Uncomment Line(s) - Removes wing comments "//" from the beginning of all
      selected lines (including lines only partially selected), then indents
      the affected lines.  Does not change lines with block comments or any non-
      whitespace characters before the "//" characters.
    Clear Line - Removes all characters between the current cursor position and
      the end of the line.  If there are none, the newline character is removed
      instead.  The system clipboard is unaffected.

  - Unit tests for the features above are implemented in
    edu.rice.cs.drjava.model.definitions.CommentTest and
    edu.rice.cs.drjava.ui.MainFrameTest.

  - Default keyboard shortcut for "Cut Line" was changed to
    (Ctrl/Cmd)+(Alt/Option)+K.  (Ctrl/Cmd)+K is now the default key for
    "Clear Line", which doesn't have the invisible side-effects of "Cut Line".

  - Added "@version $Id$" tags to the platform framework source files.  (Classes
    were not recompiled for this trivial change.)

  - Changed a null check in DefinitionsDocument to use the new isAvailable()
    method for detecting the presence of the debugger.

  - Added new "com.apple.mrj.application.JVMVersion=1.3+" property to the
    Mac OS X package's Info.plist file.  This will allow the bundled DrJava.app
    to use the 1.4.1 JVM on Mac OS X, if it is available.

- refactored the UndoManager, moving our UndoManager to the
DefinitionsDocument from the DefinitionsPane

- added startCompoundEdit() and endCompoundEdit() to our UndoManager,
methods for making compound undo actions

- modified indentLines(), commentLines(), uncommentLines() in DefinitionsDocument
to incorporate calls to start/endCompoundEdit(), so that

- made global changes to any document with unComment in it, changing it to the
more sensible uncomment


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1201 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed bug 683320 ("Canceling Save During Quit"), so that if the user
   tries to quit (or close) a modified document, chooses Save, but
   cancels the file chooser dialog, DrJava will not quit (or close the
   document).  Required modifying save/saveAs to return a boolean.

 - Added configurable support for anti-aliased text in the DefinitionsPane,
   which is off by default but can be turned on in the Fonts section
   of the Preferences window.  Slightly slower, but looks good.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1203 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Task 70902 and Bug 636722 squashed.  Fixed exception window generation from Open File dialog


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1205 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed bug 686849 ("Can't use JSR-14 with latest dev release").  It
   turned out that if any copy of JSR-14 or tools.jar was on the
   classpath when starting DrJava, it would prevent the user from
   specifying his own copy in the preferences.  Since the latest dev
   release always put tools.jar on the classpath, JSR-14 couldn't be used.
   This was fixed by giving the JSR14 compiler adapter's URLClassLoader a
   null parent so that it couldn't check the classpath before looking in
   the URLs.  (This is what we incorrectly expected URLClassLoader to do
   in the first place.)

 - Fixed build.xml to *not* include the inner classes of test classes in
   the jar file.  Cut down the size of the jar file by about 60 KB.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1207 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Actually fixed bug 595735 ("can't use JSR14 on OS X"), which had been
   closed with a difficult workaround.  By preventing the URLClassLoader
   in the JSR14 compiler adapters from looking at the bootclasspath,
   DrJava can now use JSR-14 in OS X without any special options on the
   command line.

 - Removed the corresponding logic to restart with "-Xbootclasspath" if
   JSR-14 can't be loaded.  (Code was in DrJava.java and CompilerRegistry,
   but wasn't working yet anyway.)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1209 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Modified ToolsJarClassLoader to only return Files/URLs of possible
   tools.jar files that actually exist.

 - Added StrictURLClassLoader, which enforces that it loads resources only
   from the URLs specified, rather than looking at the system classloader
   or bootclasspath first.  Allows us to find JSR-14 if tools.jar is on
   the classpath before it.  (Also added a test class for it.)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1211 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated DependenciesTest to require the new StrictURLClassLoader in util.

 - Fixed the JSR14 compiler adapter classes to correctly load the JSR-14
   classes from the specified jar file, regardless of the system class
   loader or bootclasspath.  This fixed both the inability to use JSR-14
   on the latest dev release and on OS X.

 - Added a test to ensure that generic compilers work to
   GlobalModelCompileTest.

 - Changed "Javac Location" to "Tools.jar Location" in Preferences.

 - Renamed "Comment Out Line(s)" to "Comment Line(s)" to mirror "Uncomment
   Line(s)" and be consistent with other IDEs.

 - Updated several sections of the user documentation and developer
   documentation.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1233 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed a bug with undoing, where pressing <Enter> and then undoing would
only undo the indentation of the new line, then another undo must be
signaled in order to undo the insertion of the newline.

- Refactored OurUndoManager.  It was a private inner class on
DefinitionsDocument, but we moved it into its own public class
CompoundUndoManager so that the ui can begin compound edits.

- added functionality to the compound edit capacity of CompoundUndoManager
so that multiple CompoundEdits can be nested.  In order to enforce that
the edits are well-nested, we return a key (an int) when the edit is added
to the CompoundUndoManager, which must be passed into the
endCompoundEdit() method.

Added two bug fixes to DynamicJava.
 - "Integer i = new Object()" is now rejected as a bad assignment.
 - Fixed an issue where a NoClassDefFoundError would be thrown if a variable
   had the same name as a class, but with different capitalization.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1239 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Note: This commit requires an update to the lib directory to get the new
copy of DynamicJava.

 - Added a test to ensure the intepreter rejected "Integer i = new Object()"

 - Added a test to ensure DynamicJava wouldn't blow up if a variable name
   was the same as a classname but with a different capitalization.
   (Tricky to reproduce.  Try "testClass = new TestClass()" on OS X.)

 - Stopped using TypeCheckerExtension, since the newer dynamicjava.jar
   correctly avoids division by zero in conditional statements with
   short-circuiting.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1240 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

312 bug fixes task #70906, two indent bugs fixed.  need to update indent/package.html


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1242 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Refactored InteractionsPane into an MVC design.  This involved moving
   the actions and listeners to InteractionsController, which is now much
   easier to test (and realize what isn't tested).  Fixed several small
   bugs in the process by adding new tests.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1244 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added testCompoundUndoManager() to DefinitionsDocumentTest.java


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1246 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added tearDown methods to several test cases to try to get a bit of
   memory cleaned up between the tests.  I've been running out of memory
   when running the tests because so many objects in DrJava can't be
   garbage collected.  (eg. static config framework references instance
   variables through its listeners)  I'm working on refactoring all this...

 - Started work on making Shift+Backspace behave like Backspace.  Had to
   give up because the key binding manager doesn't support having two
   actions bound to the same key.  (Argh...)  More work is needed here,
   but there is a test for this feature in DefinitionsPaneTest (commented
   out).


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1248 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- added tests to testCompoundUndoManager() in DefinitionsDocumentTest.java


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1250 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added a new edu.rice.cs.util.text package to contain DocumenAdapter
   classes.

 - Added a DocumentAdapter interface, which supports most common methods
   for interacting with a document, but in a toolkit-independent manner.
   This allows Swing and SWT (Eclipse) documents to be used by the same
   model.  This interface also supports imposing a condition on which
   edits are accepted, using a DocumentEditCondition command object.

 - Implemented the DocumentAdapter interface with a SwingDocumentAdapter,
   using a traditional DefaultStyledDocument.  Includes test class.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1252 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Finally fixed Dancing UI bug.  Introduced new class MultiThreadedTestCase for dealing with JUnit tests with multiple threads.  Added unit tests to MainFrameTest to test for the dancing UI bug.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1254 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated DependenciesTest to require a new version of util with the new
   toolkit-independent DocumentAdapter classes.  These are provided so the
   model can interact with a traditional document without knowing whether
   it is a Swing document or an SWT (Eclipse) document (or others).

 - Further refactored InteractionsDocument to use the new DocumentAdapter.
   An AbstractInteractionsDocument can now be created using any type of
   underlying document model.  Part of this refactoring involved moving
   the interactions-specific formatting styles to the controller.  (They
   didn't really belong in the model anyway-- it should be up to the
   view/controller to decide how to display text.)

   Currently, the DefaultGlobalModel still knows it's using a
   SwingDocumentAdapter, but that's ok for now.  It's using several other
   Swing Documents anyway.

 - Slightly refactored History to allow it to take in the max size as an
   argument, rather than using the config option and setting up an option
   listener.  Eclipse seemed to crash if the config framework was
   instantiated.

 - Removed tab characters and braceless-"if"s from History to adhere to
   our coding conventions.

 - Added a dispose() method to DefaultGlobalModel to be called from tests,
   so that its interpreter JVM can be killed and not kept around for all
   the tests.  Overrode dispose() in MainFrame to call this as well.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1256 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Initial revision


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1258 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Committing initial revision of the Eclipse interactions plugin,
at the top-level drjava CVS module.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1262 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

fixed UI undo state by overriding canUdelete and shift-backspace ease of use issue by adding a conditional statement in DefinitionsPane.processKeyEvent() that checks every keystroke with a shift in it and acts accordingly


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1263 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Moved accessors for the EditCondition to the DocumentAdapter interface.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1265 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated DependenciesTest to require the new util commit, which updates
   the DocumentAdapter interface.

 - Imposed an EditCondition in the InteractionsDocument (rather than the
   controller), to ensure it was used both in DrJava and Eclipse.

 - Added an EventNotifier class to the model package, to abstract out the
   listener management from the GlobalModel.  This allows us to have model
   components fire events to the model listeners through a common
   interface, without requiring *everything* to have a reference to the
   GlobalModel itself.  (Instead, we just pass in the model's
   EventNotifier.)

 - DefinitionsDocument and CompoundUndoManager now use an EventNotifier to
   notify the view when an undoable edit happens, so that the Undo and
   Redo buttons can be updated appropriately.

 - MainFrame's ModelListener now updates the Undo and Redo buttons, rather
   than DefinitionsPane itself.  This will eventually get moved out to the
   controller.

 - Modified DefinitionsEditorKit to use the correct EventNotifier.  This
   required changes in DefinitionsPane, which had a static
   DefinitionsEditorKit it used in its superclass's constructor.  (I hate
   the way these EditorKits are used, and the fact that JEditorPane can't
   take a Document in its constructor.)  It is now required to call the
   static DefinitionsPane method setEditorKit(...) *before* instantiating
   a DefinitionsPane.  It should be set to the DefaultGlobalModel's editor
   kit.  (Currently this only happens in MainFrame.)

 - Fixed the undo/comment related tests in MainFrameTest.

 - Corrected SingleDisplayModel so that it only tries to notify
   activeDocumentChanged on the listeners that are *actually*
   SingleDisplayModelListeners (to avoid a potential ClassCastException).


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1267 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added isMacPlatform() and isMac13Platform() methods.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1269 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added isMacPlatform() and isMac14Platform() methods.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1270 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added isWindowsPlatform() method.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1271 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added isMacPlatform(), isMac13Platform(), isMac14Platform(), and
isWindowsPlatform() methods in the appropriate classes.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1272 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Disabled anti-aliased text in "stable" builds for the time being, at
   least until we can get something reasonable working in OS X.

 - Added isMacPlatform(), isMac13Platform(), isMac14Platform(), and
   isWindowsPlatform() methods to PlatformSupport, and updated
   platform.jar accordingly.  (This requires an update to the lib
   directory.)

 - Updated KeyStrokeOption and InterpreterJVM to use the new platform
   methods rather than do their own platform detection.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1273 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added the system classpath to the classloader used by JUnit tests, to
   make it easier to run tests without specifying everything in the
   Preferences "Extra Classpath".

 - Fixed bug 681544 ("Compile all with untitled").  Compiling now ignores
   any unmodified, unsaved documents.

 - Added a getCompilerErrorString() utility method in GlobalModelTestCase
   to make it easier to see all the errors if a compilation fails during a
   test.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1275 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

platform.jar somehow had a copy of PlatformSupport without the
isWindowsPlatform method.  Now fixed.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1277 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1278 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed the InteractionsPane so that it is not editable before the
   prompt.  Added a test to make sure this doesn't happen again.

 - Gave ExceptionReturnedException (in model/repl) a better toString.

 - Included src-mac13, src-mac14, and src-windows in the source release.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1279 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Committing the stable version for a beta release.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1281 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Renamed plugin to edu.rice.cs.drjava, added version number (0.0.1).
 - Added a beep to the interactions view.
 - Ensured interactions pane scrolls to bottom.
 - Added a new icon.

Changed the packaging directory for the Eclipse plugin.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1284 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1285 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1286 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Removed all platform-specific source trees from the Javadoc target.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1288 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Recompiled WindowsPlatform.java with a 1.3 compiler, since it broke
on 1.3 when compiled with a 1.4 compiler.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1289 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Ensured History does not overwrite an existing file without prompting.
   Added a corresponding test.

 - Prevented History save dialog from filling in the name of the current
   class file as the default filename.

 - Eliminated the use of null as a value in History.writeToFile.

 - Updated the OS X application bundle to use Java 1.4.1 if it is
   available.  It should still work with 1.3.1 if 1.4.1 is not installed.
   (Slight issue: the icon switches to the default Java icon during
   startup in 1.4.1.  It seems some other applications have this problem
   too.)

 - Switched resetInteractionsClasspath to put the paths in config on the
   classpath before the source roots of the open documents.  This is not
   ideal, but it's consistent with the state of the classpath before
   clicking Reset.  (Config is added on startup, and documents are
   appended to the end as they are opened.)  Ideally, we'd like to insert
   the source roots at the front as they are opened, but that's not really
   an option.  This partially alleviates bug 702733, in which the order of
   the Interactions classpath can cause problems with static fields.

 - Made the MainFrameTest silent by using a TestBeep.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1290 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed a NullPointerException that occurred if a JUnit test had null for
   a testName.

 - The changes for the "dancing UI" problem caused DrJava to lock up if
   the debugger tried to open a file.  I'm not entirely sure why, but
   invokeAndWait would never return if the other JVM was suspended.  (The
   event dispatch thread might have been trying to acquire a lock that a
   suspended thread was holding?)   For now, we don't invokeAndWait if
   MainFrame is inDebugMode().

 - Added a "Copy Stack Trace" button to UncaughtExceptionWindow, since it
   is not easy to copy by hand on OS X.  (For some reason, Ctrl+C invokes
   copy in JTextAreas on OS X, and not Command+C as it should be.)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1292 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Committing stable version for a stable release.

 - Fixed bug 687369, where indent/comment/uncomment would be applied to
   the wrong line if chosen from a menu.  This was fixed by calling
   _doc.syncCurrentLocationWithDefinitions().

 - Added "Tab" as the mnemonic for Indent Lines in the Edit menu.

 - Updated the user documentation.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1294 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Changed AbstractMasterJVM to allow the classpath to be specified
   for the slave.  (Necessary for Eclipse, since Eclipse's classpath
   doesn't contain the DrJava jar.)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1296 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated DependenciesTest to require the new version of util, which
   allows AbstractMasterJVM to specify the classpath for the slave.

 - Completed the refactoring of the interactions functionality for Eclipse.
   This includes:

   - Combined all the InteractionsDocument classes into a single class,
     which only contains document-related functionality.

   - Added an InteractionsModel abstract class, which provides almost all
     of the functionality for interactions, aside from doing the actual
     interpretation and notifying the listeners.  Subclasses which provide
     these functions include RMIInteractionsModel, DefaultInteractionsModel,
     and SimpleInteractionsModel (which runs in a single JVM).

   - Moved as much interactions functionality as possible from
     DefaultGlobalModel to InteractionsModel.

   - MainJVM now notifies interaction and JUnit related events through
     callback interfaces.  Currently, InteractionsModel implements
     InteractionsModelCallback and  DefaultGlobalModel implements
     JUnitModelCallback.  (We'll add a JUnitModel later.)

 - Added methods on JavaInterpreter to define variables and set whether
   private fields and methods can be accessed.

 - Added a "-debugConsole" command line argument to DrJava, which can open
   a separate interactions window with access to the components of DrJava.
   Predefined variables include "mainFrame", "model", and "config".  Note
   that private fields and methods *are* accessible in this console.

 - Simplified the common error messages in the Interactions Pane by
   replacing koala.dynamicjava.interpreter.error.ExecutionError with
   "Error".  (Same for edu.rice.cs.drjava.model.repl.InteractionsException.)

 - Ensured that the MainJVM logs are not written in the stable builds.
   (Just in case they get left on by mistake...)

 - Fixed InteractionsController to move the caret to the correct position
   if text is inserted by another process.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1298 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Prevented *TestCase.class from being added to the jar.

 - Added a "userdocs-pdf" target to generate the user documentation as a PDF.

 - Fixed MainJVM so that the replCalledSystemExit method does not get
   called while the model is quitting.  (Was causing problems in Eclipse.)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1300 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Modified the Interactions Pane plugin to use a separate JVM for the
   interpreter (through the MainJVM framework in DrJava).

 - EclipsePlugin can now return a string with the file location of the
   plugin's jar file, to be used on the classpath to start the JVM.

 - SWTDocumentAdapter now has support for styles and correctly enforces
   the edit condition.

 - Fixed the controller to properly update the view and respond to the
   model.

 - Added a busy cursor while an interpretation is in progress and a popup
   dialog if the interpreter JVM exits unexpectedly.

 - Changed plugin version to 0.0.2.

 - Updated eclipse.sh to contain necessary classpaths.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1302 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Implemented file backups emacs-style and non-destructive write failure.  Also removed a test from HistoryTest that caused problems on Windows and was duplicated in GlobalModelIOTest.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1303 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Checking in changes to FileOps and FileOpsTest that were part of implementing emacs style backups.  I did this in the wrong order, as I mistakenly thought running ant commit inside of the drjava directory would take care of this.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1305 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

fixed bug "681203 Comment Indenting".  Took a lot of refactoring, as I had to add to every method in the indent stack trace a new parameter to track what user action caused the indent.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1307 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Debugger has been extended to allow for debugging multiple threads.   User can now suspend arbitrary threads and switch between suspended threads.  This is the first step in allowing interactions at a breakpoint. (Eliot)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1309 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Fixed Debug classes to work with Java1.3.1


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1311 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Modified SlafveveJVMRunner.java so that it can handle either a Singsingleton ONLY fiestatic ONLY singleton field of a SlaveRemote, or if that fails, it triesa  to create a new instance.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1313 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Changed InterpreterJVM so that it is a singleton.  Also refactored some code in DebugPanel, and changed JPDADebugger so that it notifies the view when the current thread is set.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1315 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed a bug in InteractionsController which caused typed characters
   inserted into an existing command to be interspersed with the
   existing characters (the caret was advanced too far on each character).
   Fixes bug 709190.

 - Fixed bug 704006, where an IllegalArgumentException was thrown
   in the CompilerErrorPanel.  Fails more gracefully now.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1317 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added two tests for the JUnitErrorModel

- Fixed the debugger's thread table so that it only displays
  live threads

- Changed the message displayed when a thread is selected
  to become the current thread


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1319 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Implemented searching in reverse and test for it.  Also cleaned up some slight search bugs that were pre-existing and wrote tests for them.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1321 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

implemented search backwards.  fixed comment line breakup from my previous commit


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1323 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added a method to InterpreterJVM that creates a named JavaInterpreter, and an accessor to the Hashtable of JavaInterpreters.  Also added a method on RMIInteractionsModel to create a named DynamicJavaAdapter.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1325 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added a lightweight test for InterpreterJVM in a new file, InterpreterJVMTest.  This test verifies ability to add a named JavaInterpreter to the InterpreterJVM.

- refactored DebugPanel, so there is now a DebugMouseAdapter, which is used in a ThreadMouseAdapter and StackMouseAdapter.  These adapters allow for double-click actions and right-click menus on the thread/stack tables.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1327 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed the SocketClosed Exception on debugger restarts.

- The stack frame is correctly displayed.

- The user can no longer suspend a thread that has no stackframes.

- The thread table will highlight the current thread in bold
  upon hitting breakpoints or switching to the next active thread
  after the current thread has died.

- The JPDADebugger has the handle to the instance of the InterpreterJVM
  as an ObjectReference.

- Bug: sometimes two BreakpointEvents are fired for one breakpoint which
  causes problems since the same thread is pushed twice onto the
  stck of suspended threads.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1329 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Javadoc is demo-able.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1331 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added a concept of a currently active interpreter to InterpreterJVM, and
added functionality in RMIInteractionsModel to switch the currently active
thread.

- Added a test in InterpreterJVMTest to verify that the functionality in
InterpreterJVM correctly switches the active interpreter.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1333 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added stuff to generate all packages from a source root and the test.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1335 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed RMIInteractionsModel to switch debug interpreters using RMI,
   rather than (incorrectly) modifying a singleton instance of
   InterpreterJVM in the local JVM.  Calls are now made through MainJVM,
   with tests provided in NewJVMTest.

 - Added an interpreterChanged event to GlobalModelListener, which is
   fired when RMIInteractionsModel changes the active interpreter.

 - Fixed DebugTest to pass on other machines, since timing issues weren't
   quite right in one of the multithreaded tests.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1337 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Extended the right-click menu in the debugger's thread table so that the user can now
resume suspended threads individually.

- Enhanced the debugger's stack table so that double-clicking on a stack item will
scroll to the corresponding source.  The same thing can also be done through a
right-click menu.

- Fixed CompoundUndoManager so that it won't blow up after two million or so edits.  In
the extreme case, I guess it's still limited to two million depth of nested
CompoundEdits.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1339 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Made several syntax highlighting methods in DefinitionsDocument
   protected instead of private, to allow subclasses to define alternate
   sets of keywords, etc.

 - Made _compileFiles in DefaultGlobalModel protected instead of private,
   to allow subclasses to define alternate compilers for files with
   different filename extensions.

 - Added a generic "Interpreter" interface (which is extended by
   JavaInterpreter) to support interpreters for additional languages.
   Will be initially used for Siris, the Scala interpreter.

 - Refactored InterpreterJVM to support the use of alternate
   implementations of the Interpreter interface.

 - Fixed a bug in InterpreterJVM where the classpaths of different
   JavaInterpreters would become inconsistent.

 - Fixed a bug in InterpreterJVM where an interpreter would remain
   "inProgress" if an exception was thrown.

 - Made RMIInteractionsModel.setActiveInterpreter print a new prompt.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1341 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Contains many improvements in allowing interactions at
  a breakpoint. These new features are not yet usable since
  the task is not complete.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1343 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added defineConstant methods on DynamicJavaAdapter.

 - Changed MainJVM to use InterpreterJVM's class name as a constant
   instead of asking for it from the class, which was instantiating the
   Singleton instance unnecessarily.

 - Changed references to JavaInterpreter.NO_RESULT to Interpreter.NO_RESULT

 - Resolved a strange VerifyError in DynamicJavaAdapter by changing the
   type of _djInterpreter from TreeInterpreter to DynamicJava's
   Interpreter class.  Not sure why this was necessary.

 - Fixed DebugTest to stop hanging on some Linux machines.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1345 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed InterpreterJVM to only call addClassPath(s) with a single path at
   a time rather than multiple paths with path separators.  This allows
   newly created interpreters to receive the correct classpath (in the
   debugger).


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1347 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added a getVariable(String name) method to JavaInterpreter and
   DynamicJavaAdapter, so that the values of variables in the interpreter
   can be queried externally.  Tested in JavaInterpreterTest.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1349 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added JavaDebugInterpreter, a DynamicJavaAdapter for interactions in the
  debugger

- Added a lightweight test for JavaDebugInterpreter in a new file,
  JavaDebugInterpreterTest.  This test verifies the ability to notify when an
assignment has been made in a debug interpreter.

- Added DebugEvaluationVisitor, an EvaluationVisitorExtension that notifies
  the interpreter jvm on every assignment expression

- Added DebugModelCallback, an interface which allows a Debugger to respond to
  events fired in a remote jvm

- Added a call to interpreter.setPrivateAccessible(true) in

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1351 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Small refactoring of FileOps.packageExplore to expose FileFilter for *.java.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1353 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Updates for JavaDoc integration:
  -  Toolbar button renamed "JavaDoc" from "Doc" in MainFrame
  -  Cleaned up dialog for destination directory in MainFrame
  -  Added check for non-existent or unwritable destination in MainFrame
  -  Revamped package traversal code for culling JD parameters in
       DefaultGlobalModel
  -  Added config option to control whether only child packages of the
       currently open packages are JDed or if all packages from the source
       roots down are all JDed in OptionConstants
  -  Added new config checkbox for above in ConfigFrame

  Status:  Currently, JavaDoc generation is functional, but somewhat ugly.
  -  JD is called in an external JVM for all versions - we should be able to
       save time by running in-process on 1.4.
  -  All output is routed to the Console - we should parse this to an
       error tab.  Tim is refactoring the error tabs to facilitate this.
  -  We currently make no attempt to pre-process to remove generics.
       Therefore, JD will die a thousand deaths when trying to JD DrJava
       itself.  This is my next task.
  -  We always open a new HTMLFrame, whether or not output is generated.
  -  Multiple HTMLFrames can accumulate on screen - we should reuse one.
  -  There is no option to view the results in an external browser.  This
       turns out to be a very platform-dependent operation.  There is a
       SourceForge project devoted to doing this with reflection, called
       BrowserLauncher.  Maybe we can disect portions and compile it using
       the platform framework instead of refl.
  -  The JavaScript generated by 1.4 isn't parsed properly by the
       HTMLFrame, leaving an ugly exposed tag.  This may not be fixed.

- Updated DependenciesTest to require the new InputStreamRedirector from

to allow input to be entered into the console at a prompt.

- MainJVM now asks for input from the DefaultInteractionsModel, which
redirects through DefaultGlobalModel to an InputListener which must be
registered there.

MulitThreadedTestCase since it makes sense in any multithreaded test.

while there is no prompt.  It is now considered to be inProgress while
resetting.

InteractionsController moved to AbstractConsoleController.

console pane as well, and removed OutputPane.

context menu is brought up.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1399 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed a bug in the debugger where if the thread tab was not enabled, we
would get NullPointerExceptions all over the place.

- Fixed a bug where stepping into a breakpoint would push the same thread
onto the stack twice, and cause extremely unstable behavior in the
debugger, including the death of the EventHandler thread.

- If there was an unexpected expection in the EventHandler, it would not
catch it, and die.  As a result, the DebugPanel would not be hidden when
the interactions pane was reset.  Now, the EventHandler catches any
unexpected exceptions, and prints an error.  The debugger then continues
running so that the user can save any needed state before resetting.

modified DynamicJavaAdapter so that all the debug interpreters use the same StickyClassLoader instantiated for the default interpreter.  Also fixed a bug in JPDADebugger/EventHandler where stepping into a breakpoint would cause the debugger to break.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1405 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Revised JPDADebugger to make it fail-fast in many cases where
   it was silently catching exceptions or returning before.  This
   should help track down incorrect uses of the debugger, which
   often lead to tricky bugs.

 - Renamed EventHandler to EventHandlerThread for clarity.

 - Cleaned up parts of DebugTest and removed redundant checks.

 - Removed suspend and notifyDebugInterpreterAssignment functionality,
   neither of which are currently in use.

 - Updated DependenciesTest to require the new Log class.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1407 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff
