Vector<Boolean> or Vector<Integer> since the new typechecker requires
this,

- changed variables named enum in DefaultGlobalModel and CompilerProxy to
en since enum is now a keyword,

- changed the VectorOptionComponent constructor to take Vector<File>
rather than Vector, again for the new typechecker,

- and moved the inline instantiation of a String[] in AboutDialog to a
variable declaration to avoid an issue with variance.

These changes were made so our source would be compatible with jsr14 v2.0.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1414 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Changes:
    Javadoc integration improvements.
    - Several bug fixes (no longer attempts to Javadoc untitled files).
    - New "Javadoc Errors" panel using CompilerError framework.
    - Work is now performed in a worker thread.
    - Result parsing is more robust.

    CompilerErrorModel improvements.
    - Setup code refactored for efficiency and readability.
    - New unit tests for have been provided.

    Several GlobalModel methods extracted to superinterfaces.
    - IGetDocuments includes only methods to get OpenDefinitionsDocuments from the model.
    - ILoadDocuments includes only methods to load ODDs from some kind of storage.
    - InteractionsListener includes only methods related to managing the interpreter.
    - Several method names in GlobalModel were changed for consistency with InteractionsListener.
    - Dummy implementations of IGetDocuments and OpenDefinitionsDocument have been provided.

    Comment indent fix.
    - Comment Line command no longer inserts a space after the comment characters.

  Open Issues:
    Javadoc.
    - One-off error with line highlighting.
    - Spurious hang bug when building result CompilerErrorModel.
    - Some stderr debug output still enabled.
    - Trying to use Javadoc < 1.4 with 1.4-generated classfiles will fail.
    - Trying to use Javadoc > 1.3 with a 1.3 compiler enabled will fail.

    Refactorings.
    - Listener superinterfaces for GetDocuments and LoadDocuments need to be defined.
    - Additional dummy implementations for ILoadDocuments and InteractionsListener should be provided.
    - GlobalModel should be broken down further.
    - OpenDefinitionsDocument and DefinitionsDocument should be refactored in a similar way.

- already added a new branch to the source, in src-jsr14v2_0, which updates
compilers.jar with the new JSR14v20Compiler class using the ant
compile-jsr14v2_0 task.

- updated CompilerRegistry and CompilerProxy to support the new jsr14 v2.0
compiler adapter, and added JSR14v20FromSetLocation.

- updated ConfigFrame so that calls to PanelTreeNode.getPath() are stored to
a temporary TreeNode[].  This works around a bug in the jsr14 v2.0 compiler
where the type of new TreePath(PanelTreeNode.getPath()).getLastPathElement()
would have type TreeNode[] instead of PanelTreeNode.  What the hell, the
exact same code works with older versions of JSR14.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1420 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added a "Reset Interactions" menu item to the toolbar menu and context
   menu for the Interactions view.

 - Resetting the Interactions Pane now pulls in the classpath entries
   from all open projects.

 - If any changes are made to compiled class files while the Interactions
   Pane is being used, a warning message is printed, instructing the user
   to reset the Interactions Pane to get updated class files.  This is
   not done automatically because it could potentially occur any time the
   user saves a file.

 - Dialog boxes are now created using JFace, allowing them to have titles.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1425 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Made all Test classes final, so that they won't be mistakenly subclassed.
   (A subclass of a TestCase will inherit all the parent's test methods,
   causing the tests to be run multiple times.)

 - Fixed a bug in the debugger where stepping would fail if it tried
   to define a null value.

 - Added logic to InteractionsModel and DefaultGlobalModel to only reset
   interactions after a compile if the Interactions Pane has been used
   since the last reset.  Also, the console is not reset after a compile.
   (This helps view old errors.  It can be easily cleared with the
   right click menu.)

 - Renamed "Javadoc Errors" tab to "Javadoc Output" to be consistent.

interactions pane.  A new action gets called on MainFrame, which asks DefaultGlobalModel for the
interactions classpath.  MainJVM now maintains a list containing the system classpath, and when
requested, appends the InterpreterJVM's extra classpath to that and returns it.

is now used to display the interactions classpath.

- modified DrJava.java so that if DrJava is started with jsr14 v2.0 in the preferences
but not on the bootclasspath, DrJava dies and restarts with the jar on the
bootclasspath.

- modified InterpreterJVM so that if DrJava is using jsr14 v2.0, as determined at
startup by DrJava.java, the interactions pane will also be given jsr14 v2.0 on its
bootclasspath.

- added an option listener in MainFrame that will warn the user if he/she tries to set
the jsr14 version to an unusable one give his/her current boot classpath.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1439 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixes the following problems in the debugger:
  - AbsentInformationException when trying to debug classes that are not
    compiled with the '-g' flag.
    A suggestion to recompile is now printed.
  - ObjectCollectedExcetpion when an object that is created in the InterpreterJVM
    is garbage collected before we use it.
    We repeat the series of commands to further reduce an already small chance
    of this happening.
  - ClassNotLoadedException when trying to copy the value of a variable back
    from the InterpreterJVM to the MainJVM and the value's type has not been
    loaded in the appropriate class loader.
    We're not sure exactly which class loaders are causing the problem, but we
    ignore this and print out a warning that the variable could not be updated.
    This problem seems to occur very infrequently.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1440 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1442 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

      (JDK 1.3 uses stdout, but JDK 1.4 uses stderr).

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1448 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- The interpreterResetting event is now fired before trying to
  kill the interpreter JVM instead of after discovering that it
  has died in the main JVM. This reduces the time between
  clicking the reset button and receiving notice that the
  interactions pane is resetting. This addresses support
  request #753611.

- The debugger now ignores InvalidTypeExceptions. It would
  get these exceptions occasionally when trying to set the
  value of a variable saying that it could not assign an
  object of a certain type to an object of the exact same
  type. The error would not occur the next time the same
  action was tried.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1463 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added Clover tasks to build-common.xml to generate HTML test coverage
   reports.  Run "ant clover" in either the drjava or util directories to
   generate a "clover" directory next to your source root.  All developers
   will need to run "cvs update" in their lib directory to get the
   clover.jar and add it to their classpath.

 - Re-enabled the Interactions Pre-processor, now that the parens bug
   (750605) has been fixed.

 - Updated DependenciesTest to require the fix to StickyClassLoader
   (support request 752033).

 - Corrected DynamicJavaAdapter to use a ClassLoaderContainer rather than
   a ClassLoader directly as the AdditionalClassLoaderContainer for each
   Context.  This corrects a classloading issue (bug 757409).

 - Typing a brace or colon in a string or comment no longer causes an
   immediate indent.

 - Commented out the unused tab() method in DefinitionsDocument.

 - Changed GlobalModelTestCase to create a new model from scratch in each
   test.  The old approach of sharing MainJVM's was causing too many
   headaches with events in one test affecting another test.

 - GlobalModelTestCase.TestListener now appends the stack trace of its own
   creation to the listenerFail message, so that it is easy to see which
   listener is failing.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1464 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed InterpreterJVM.interpret to use the pre-processed String,
   not the original string.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1466 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Disabling the Interactions Pre-processor *again* until the bugginess
   can be resolved.  Right now, it isn't type-erasing everything.
   Vector<String> v = new Vector<String>() becomes:
   (((Vector) < (String)) > (v) = new Vector())


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1468 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Re-enabled the Interactions Preprocessor, with the understanding that
   the semicolons issue will shortly be resolved.  (Hopefully, it won't be
   as strict in requiring semicolons in obscure cases.)

 - No longer inserts unnecessary prompts when closing the debugger.

 - The "java Classname args" shortcut now more correctly parses the
   arguments if quotes or backslashes are present.

 - Fixed compilers.jar for Java 1.3, improved the detection logic, and
   removed printlns.  Also, we now enforce that DrJava classes won't be
   pulled into compilers.jar.

 - JSR-14 v2.0 is not allowed in Java 1.3.  (A warning message is
   displayed if the user tries to use it.)

 - Fixed the "View Classpath" command to include the last entry of the
   system classpath, which it was missing before.

 - Cleaned up InteractionsProcessor and added small acceptance tests.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1470 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Committing fixes to compiler detection logic in compilers.jar and
parens in javaast.jar.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1472 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

JSR-14 v1.0 compiler adapter now correctly identifies when it is not
available, and JavacGJCompiler no longer blows up if java.lang.Enum
can't be found.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1473 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

JSR14v12Compiler no longer blows up if java.lang.Enum can't be found.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1474 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1475 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed a BadLocationException that occured whenever
  there were multiple files with errors and the model
  would incorrectly try to determine if an error on one
  file was at a certain offset on another file.

- Fixed a problem where changing compilers or closing the
  compiler output tab would not remove the highlighting
  of compiler errors in the source.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1476 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- made ClasspathFilter a singleton

- refactored the config so that all of the FileOptionComponents share the same
  JFileChooser, and so that within each VectorOptionComponent, the JFileChooser
  is persistent.

- fixed a stupid stupid stupid jsr14 v2.0-related bug in config frame, where
  using a TreePath would eventually result in a ClassCastException.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1477 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed the interactions pane so that the previous and next word actions
  behave in the same manner as the left and right arrows, wrapping and not
  allowing the caret to move before the prompt.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1479 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Changes for Javadoc
  - added several new options to OptionConstants
  - added a new panel to the ConfigFrame for Javadoc options
  - created a new type of Option called ForcedChoiceOption
  - created a new OptionComponent to display a ForcedChoiceOption as an
      uneditable combo box
  - refactored Javadoc start logic to put more code in DefaultGlobalModel
  - created a new DirectorySelector interface for use with Javadoc
  - added new logic for Javadoc access level, default destination, always
      prompting for destination, system doc link version and URL, and custom
      Javadoc parameters.
  - several fixes to Javadoc argument setup, particularly for classpaths
  - better handling of error conditions for moved files and IOExceptions

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1490 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added a mouse listener to the breakpoint tree so that a user can scroll to
  the source of a breakpoint, or remove the breakpoint from a right-click menu.
  Also some minor refactoring of the way the other context menus are set up.

- Scrolling to source from the stack table or the breakpoint tree does not
  highlight and always sets the caret to the appropriate line.

- Added a third argument to the threadLocationUpdated method of DebugListener
  so that we don't always highlight.  See above change.

- Changed ErrorPanel so that it scrolls the view to the appropriate location as
  well as setting the caret position.

- Added tooltips to the OptionComponents so that, with an alternate constructor
  or a method on the OptionComponents, a description can be set that will be
  displayed on a tooltip.  Accordingly, most of the config options now have
  tooltip text giving a brief explanation of their function.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1492 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

This documentation should have been committed ages ago. . . .


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1494 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated DependenciesTest to require new helper methods in ExecJVM.

 - Fixed debugger to connect to 127.0.0.1 instead of the current hostname.

 - Updated the tool tips in the Preferences, including adding tool tips
   for colors and key bindings.

 - Added a tooltip to the ForcedChoiceOptionComponent's label.

 - Changed the Javadoc Links Version option to default to the same version
   of the JVM being used, rather than just 1.3.

 - Made sure that each test in GlobalModelCompileTest removes its listener.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1495 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Updating build-common.xml to compile with JSR-14's collect.jar.

Added a "fix-collect-v1_0" task to strip out java.lang.String and
java.util.Arrays from collect.jar, since they're broken in
JSR-14 v1.0 (they require JDK 1.4).  Any DrJava developer using
JSR-14 v1.0 will need to run this target once before DrJava will
compile.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1497 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Converted all parametric classes in the util package to use the JSR-14
   collect.jar instead of gj-util.jar.  This gives us access to a broader
   set of collections (including faster non-synchronized collections) and
   allows us to no longer make the special exception for gj-util in our
   license.  (We'll leave the license alone until we're completely free of
   gj-util.jar.)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1498 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixes bug #723346 in which an exception is thrown
  when DrJava is quit at a precise time during
  a call to reset interactions. This exception was
  preventing DrJava from ever recreating an
  interpreterJVM or quitting DrJava.

- Removed a println from JPDADebugger.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1500 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated DependenciesTest to require the new version of util, which now
   compiles against collect.jar instead of gj-util.jar.

 - Updated the documentation to mention that JSR-14 v2.0's jar is called
   gjc-rt.jar, not javac.jar.  (More documentation updates are coming
   soon.)


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1501 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Javadoc-related changes:
    - Moved all Javadoc code from DefaultGlobalModel to a new interface
    - JavadocModel defines the interface, and DefaultJavadocModel implements it
    - GlobalModel now extends JavadocModel
    - DGM forwards JavadocModel methods to an internal DefaultJavadocModel
    - JavadocModel accepts only objects
    - Moved Javadoc events to JavadocListener

  Other Refactorings:
    - EventNotifier now implements GlobalModelListener -- the prefered way to
        call events is now to call the appropriate method directly, rather than
        using a command pattern.
    - All methods on EventNotifier are now declared synchronized, rather than
        using an explicit sync block on the collection of listeners.
    - Beginning of move from gj.util collections to modified jsr14 collect.jar
    - IGetDocuments.getDefinitionsDocuments now returns a List, instead of a
        ListModel -- the old method had been renamed getDefinitionsDocs and is
        now deprecated.
    - GlobalModel.saveAllFiles has been removed as unsafe.
    - saveAllBeforeProceeding in GM and GML have been refactored into smaller,
        situation-specific methods, e.g. saveBeforeCompile().
    - Several test classes have been changed to reflect the above.
    - GML.SaveReason has been removed.
    - GM.areAnyModifiedSinceSave() has been renamed hasModifiedDocuments and
        moved to IGetDocuments.

Added "gjc-rt.jar" to the explanation of the need for JSR-14,

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1511 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed bug #745714. Searches now do not repeat
  when changing directions.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1512 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed bug #745714. Searches now do not repeat
  when changing directions.

- A couple of exceptions were thrown and printed to
  the interactions pane when killing processes
  containing security managers while the debugger
  was on. They are now caught and logged in the
  MainJVM.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1514 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Re-arranged Begins in OptionConstants to cooperate with Javadoc.

 - Updated user and developer documentation for the beta release.

 - DrJava now treats two different names for the same file (eg. /tmp/Foo
   and /tmp/./Foo) as the same file, while still displaying the absolute
   path instead of the canonical path whenever possible (since the
   canonical paths resolve symbolic links and can appear confusing).

 - Updated GlobalModelIOTest to work with canonical files.

 - Updated CompilerErrorModel and its test to work with canonical files,
   so a file can be closed and opened with a different name, and the
   errors will still highlight correctly.

 - Updated RecentFileManager and its test to work with canonical files, so
   a file won't appear multiple times in the list under different paths.

 - Added a fix for bug 707734 (null pointer on relative directory in
   Windows).

 - Added a half-second delay in the Javadoc loop while waiting for output
   from the Javadoc process.  This especially helps performance on Windows.

 - Refactored GlobalModelCompileTest into four separate tests, since it
   was far too huge, both conceptually and in memory requirements.

 - Updated DebugTest to include tests for watching fields in multiple
   nested inner classes.

 - Refactored the updateWatches method in JPDADebugger to eliminate a
   NullPointerException and add support for watching fields of multiple
   nested classes.

 - Refactored DebugWatchData to be able to hide the value and type and set
   it to have no value and type.  DebugWatchUndefinedValue is no longer
   needed.  Also removed external references to JDI's Type class, which
   shouldn't be exposed outside the debugger.

 - Removed generics from one type in DrJavaBook, which is strangely
   refusing to compile with JDK 1.3, JSR-14 v1.0 on Linux.

 - Changed JavadocFrame to show packages.html instead of the index.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1515 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed JavadocFrame so that relative links should always work on Windows,
  and made error recovery more robust.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1517 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Committing the stable version for a beta release.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1519 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Nearly completed feature request 745557 about debugging
  fields of outer classes. We can access these correctly
  except in the case of being in a static method in a
  static inner class. We cannot access outer classes in
  this case unless they are fully qualified because the
  classloader cannot load the unqualified class.

- Refactored DebugTest by pulling out some fields, methods,
  and inner classes to DebugTestCase. This allows
  JavaDebugInterpreterTest to have access to all of the
  resources it needs to use the debugger in its test.

- Added tests to JavaDebugInterpreterTest to test debugging
  of outer fields.

- Added the clean-config task to build.xml. This will
  delete all the files in the config directory. This
  allows up to compile DrJava without cleaning all the
  class files first.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1521 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- added a "make new test" command which creates a simple, empty JUnit test with empty setUp() and tearDown() methods.  This action is only enabled in development versions for now.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1523 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Changes:
    - Added new "Run Document Main Method" option in the Tools menu and document
      list context menu.  Using the menu option attempts to run the main method
      of the current class in the interactions pane via a "java ClassName" call
      This feature was requested by participants at the TeachJava workshop at
      Rice University.
    - Tweaked OpenDefinitionsDocument, DefaultGlobalModel, and others for above.
    - Fixed MainFrame.showTab method to work for interactions and console panes.
    - Rearranged items in the Tools menu for a more pleasant layout.
    - Added CTRL/CMD-SEMICOLON as a new default shortcut for opening the
      preferences dialog.
    - Changed shortcut for Uncomment Line(s) to CTRL/CMD+Shift-/ instead of
      CTRL/CMD+ALT/OPT-/.  The new shortcut holds to the convention of using
      Shift to indicate a modification of a command, while ALT/OPT is used to
      extend a command across many items.
    - Fixed a bug in CompilerErrorModel.hasOnlyWarnings - it never worked!
    - Extended CompilerErrorModelTest to include hasOnlyWarnings tests.
    - Moved TestDocGetter inner class of CompilerErrorModelTest to model package
      for future reuse.
    - Stubbed out methods for JavadocModelTest, but didn't implement them yet.
    - Added comment in JavadocModel about mandatory constructor.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1525 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

*** empty log message ***


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1527 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Completed feature request 745557 about debugging
  fields of outer classes. We can access and modify
  these correctly.

- Added tests to JavaDebugInterpreterTest to test debugging
  of outer fields from a static context.

- Changed the layout of the debug panel slightly so that the
  buttons on the right do not change size depending on
  whether the documents being debugged are in sync or not.

- Changed updateWatches to be synchronized. There seemed to
  occasionally be problems with watches at random times.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1528 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- fixed the watch table so that it is updated with the correct values while
  interacting at a breakpoint.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1529 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added the ability to debug methods of outer fields.

- After hitting breakpoints, switching the current
  thread, and stepping, the focus is always given
  to the interactions pane.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1531 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Addresses support request # 768150. A prompt is no longer
  automatically inserted in the console pane when reaching
  a System.in.

- Fixes a bug in the interpreter by extending DynamicJava's
  EvaluationVisitor. The interpreter used to accept illegal
  type assignments in variable declarations that contain
  casts (e.g. Integer i = (Integer)new Object();).

- Fixes a bug that occurs when the user is debugging a file
  which is out of sync and compiles it. Since we do
  not reset the interactions pane anymore if the user has
  not used the interactions pane, the debugger will stay
  open and the message would not disappear. Now DrJava will
  update the out of sync message after compiling.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1533 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added an ArgumentTokenizer class (and test) to parse command-line
   arguments from a single string, mimicing a Unix bash shell.

 - Added getDocStyle and setDocStyle methods to SwingDocumentAdapter to
   allow the styles to be changed dynamically.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1535 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Watches for fields in outer classes now work
  from a static context. Note that outer classes
  in this case are not necessarily loaded if the
  inner class is loaded. Therefore, watches on
  fields of non-loaded classes will not have a
  value.

- Changed the information that is displayed for
  watches whose values cannot be found.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1537 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added more detailed comments for the "New Test Case" command.

 - Made the "Run Document's Main Method" command always compile the
   document.

 - Updated DependenciesTest to require the new ArgumentTokenizer.

 - Replaced the logic in InteractionsModel to parse command-line arguments
   with the new ArgumentTokenizer in the util package.  The Javadoc
   "custom arguments" option also uses an ArgumentTokenizer.

 - Added the ability to set the font of a JTextPane on Mac OS X with JDK
   1.4.1 by applying a new AttributeSet to the contents of the pane, since
   setFont doesn't work properly.

 - Made the location of the load/save Interactions history dialog
   persistent.

 - Added a right-click menu to the watches table to remove a watch from
   the Debug Panel.

 - Prevented saveFile from saving if the file is not modified, so that
   Save All does not try to create backup files when unnecessary.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1539 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Changes:
    - Removed several unused variables in various classes.
    - Extended parser to find warnings in Javadoc output.
    - Added parametric definitions in several places for better static checking.
    - JavadocFrame now opens the HTML for the current document by default.
    - " also has a check to parse a "bad" packages.html and follow the "No Frames" link.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1541 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated documentation for the updated beta release.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1542 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- added a method on StringOps to get the stack trace out of a throwable.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1544 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Made private the default access level for Javadoc.

- Made the Run Main Method command a development-only feature, pending further
  choices to be made.  Also, it only starts the compile if the class file is
  out of sync.

- Renamed TestShouldSucceedListener in GlobalModelJUnitTest to
  JUnitTestListener.

- Refactored everywhere that used a printwriter/stringwriter to get the
  stack trace of an exception to use StringOps.getStackTrace(Throwable)
  instead.

- Fixed a bug in the JUnit integration whereby anything causing the JUnit
  test running thread to blow up would cause JUnit to fail with only a
  message to the console.  Such an error is now caught and reported as a
  normal JUnit error.

- Added code in History so that when an interactions history is saved on
  Windows, the correct line separator is used instead of the default.

- Fixed a bug where when there was a JUnit error, even successful would
  bring up the file with the JUnit error.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1546 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Repaired StringOps so that getOffsetAndLength works correctly on multi-line input.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1548 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- The Run action no longer asks to compile, and is simply disabled during
  an interaction or during a reset.

- model/repl/History now compiles under JSR14 v1.0.  Apparently,
  String.replaceAll(String, String) is java1.4-specific.  Oh well, more
  stupid logic to write.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1556 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed bug 769764 ("Debugger does not stop on a breakpoint") by

   the Threads table of the debugger.

   which properly handle arguments like require:a:"Require:" (as mentioned

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1570 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- added a config option to change the look and feel.  Currently, there is
  no way to add a custom look and feel, and the feature is only enabled in
  a development version.

- made ForcedChoiceOption use a Collection<String> instead of a generic

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1571 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added a ReaderWriterLock class (and test) with a solution to the
   classic readers/writers synchronization problem which avoids deadlock
   and starvation.  The synchronization primitives in this class will be
   used to correctly synchronize DrJava's EventNotifier class.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1573 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Refactored EventNotifier to use the new ReaderWriterLock class for
   synchronization, allowing it to properly treat notifying listeners as
   read operations and adding/removing listeners as write operations.
   This eliminates the deadlock observed in bug 771762.

 - Corrected the JUnitPanel to display "Failures" and "Errors" instead of
   "Errors" and "Warnings".

 - Abstracted the common startup and shutdown code out of DebugTest into
   helper methods in DebugTestCase.

 - Added a "drjava.debug.port" System property to DrJava in the
   development branch, allowing our developers to easily debug the
   Interactions Pane from another IDE's debugger.

 - Changed "1.4.2 beta" to "1.4.2" in the docs, and replaced links with
   the full text of the URL.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1575 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- added some (partially non-working, commented-out) code that fully updates the UI on the fly to a new look and feel.  SwingUtilities.updateComponentTreeUI() must be called on every component that is not a child of main frame, so all external frames and popup menus.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1577 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Final local variables can now be watched and used in the debugger.
  This fixes bug #769174.
  At this point, the debug interpreter can see nearly every variable
  in scope exactly as it would in normal Java.
  There are three limitations:
  1) We cannot access fields of outer static class from an anonymous
     class or any inner class of an anonymous inner class.
  2) We cannot access final local variables of outer classes if we
     either do not use the variables in the body of the inner class,
     or the compiler can inline the values of the local variables into
     the body of the inner class at compile-time.
  3) We get NullPointerExceptions in the debug interpreter when
     stepping onto the heading of the constructor of an instance inner
     class and trying to reference a field of an outer class because
     the this$N field has not yet been initialized.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1586 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated DependenciesTest to require the new FileSelectorComponent.

 - The Javadoc model now supports suggesting a destination directory based
   on a given (eg. active) document.  The model now always prompts its
   DirectorySelector for a destination, using the default directory as the
   starting location (if a default is specified).

 - The Javadoc model checks to see if the destination exists, is a
   directory, and is writable, displaying a different error if any one of
   these isn't true.

 - We now display a JavadocDialog with a FileSelectorComponent when
   generating Javadoc for all documents.  The dialog shows the suggested
   directory if the model does not supply a default, unless the user has
   previously modified a suggested directory.

 - Added a DirectoryFilter class to the ui package, which is a FileFilter
   for JFileChoosers which only accepts directories.

 - The JFileChoosers in the preferences are now more correctly shared, so
   that file filters from one type of chooser do not show up in another.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1588 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixes the annoying behavior of DynamicJava when after the user tries to
  declare a variable but the statement contains an error, the user cannot
  retry the declaration after fixing the error since DynamicJava has
  already defined the variable. This is accomplished by running the NameVisitor
  and TypeChecker over the declaration before allowing DynamicJava to
  define the variables. Note that if the error occurs during the evaluation
  of the right hand side of the declaration that the variable will be defined.
  This mirrors regular Java compiler behavior since the compiler will not
  know at compile-time that the statement will fail and will not allow
  the variable to be redefined.

- Makes sure that the cursor will appear in the interaction pane instead
  of relying on a race condition on whether or not it happens.

- Allows users to call methods of outer classes from within an
  anonymous inner class.

- Fixes a bug in the evaluation of fields of outer classes from within an
  anonymous inner class.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1598 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added a deleteDirectoryOnExit to FileOps (with test), which recursively
   deletes an entire directory when the JVM exits.  (File.deleteOnExit
   won't delete a non-empty directory.)

 - Removed references to CodeStatus from Log, since the util package
   should never import from the drjava package.

 - Gave the threads in AbstractMasterJVM and AbstractSlaveJVM names, which
   can be customized by subclasses.

 - The stubFile created in AbstractMasterJVM is now deleted on exit (in
   case the new JVM doesn't start cleanly).

 - Added a slaveQuitDuringStartup method to AbstractMasterJVM, allowing
   subclasses to react if the slave JVM quits before registering
   (indicating a serious problem).


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1599 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updated DependenciesTest to require the new methods and fixes in
   AbstracMasterJVM and FileOps.

 - The ESC key now closes the Find/Replace tab.

 - Improved the warning messages for choosing a Javadoc destination.

 - Javadoc Current now deletes its temp files when DrJava exits.

 - InteractionsModel now changes the debugging port after each reset.  On
   some machines, typing "System.exit(0)" into the Interactions Pane would
   cause the new JVM to be started before the debug port from the old JVM
   was freed, preventing the new JVM from starting.

 - Improved how MainJVM responds if the new JVM doesn't start.

 - Gave several worker threads names.

 - Fixed the Quit "do not show again" checkbox so it remembers if the user
   clicks Yes, and changed several similar checkboxes to forget the
   checkbox if the user clicks No.

 - Fixed a problem with ConfigFrame where all null-keystroke options had
   the same tooltip.

 - Revised many tooltips and option names in ConfigFrame.

 - Caused several temporary files in tests to be deleted on exit.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1601 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed incorrect errors and NullPointerExceptions in simple assignments
   caused by the NameVisitorExtension.  The encapsulated TypeChecker now
   shares a context with the regular TypeChecker, instead of the
   NameVisitor.

 - Fixed a bug in KeyBindingManager where swapping keystrokes would
   prevent one of the actions from being used.  The new logic only removes
   the old keystroke from the keyToDataMap if it currently maps to the
   expected data.  (If not, it has already been remapped and does not need
   to be removed.)

 - NULL_KEYSTROKEs are now handled properly, since they can be generated
   by some Windows keyboards.  We now make sure not to trigger an action
   if a NULL_KEYSTROKE is detected.

 - New JUnit Test Case is now enabled for the stable, but without
   generating setUp and tearDown methods.  (Might as well make the default
   template as easy to understand as possible.)

 - RecentFileManagerTest now deletes the temp directories it creates.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1627 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Committing stable version for stable release.

 - Changed the Javadoc access level default to "package private".


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1629 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added "Show Debug Console" to the Tools menu as a development feature.
  (Neat!)

- Added Test All.  Now the default Test action, this feature runs JUnit over
  all open junit.framework.Test classes.  Abstractions used here have also
  allowed us better to support running tests whose suite() method returns a
  set of tests that include classes outside of the current file.

- Helping the above, the JUnitPanel is now updated on each test completion to
  reflect the fact that the test was run, indicating success or failure in
  each case.  Errors are all displayed at the bottom (it would be nice to
  interleave them with the appropriate positions in JUnitPanel where the
  tests were first shown, but this would require a significant refactoring of
  the error highlighting/management system).

- The listener interface (GlobalModelListener) has also changed.  The
  nonTestCase() event now accepts boolean isTestAll to differentiate, mainly
  for the purpose of error messages.  The junitTestEnded no longer takes an
  OpenDefinitionsDocument, since we don't know which document is being
  tested.  Finally, the junitStarted passes in a List of
  OpenDefinitionsDocument so that the JUnitPanel can be aware if any of the
  documents being tested is out of sync.

- JUnitErrors now also know the class they came from (necessary since we no
  longer automatically know which file is being tested, thanks to Test All).

- Refactored the JUnitManager so that instead of having an InterpreterJVM, it
  has a JUnitModelCallback, which InterpreterJVM now implements.  A
  JUnitModelCallback now can get the appropriate classpath to use in for our
  JUnit tests.

- Refactored the JUnit classloading so that the same class loader is used
  across any given set of tests (e.g. one click of the Test All button).  I'd
  hoped this would save memory, but it hasn't really done much.  Seems like
  better form though.

- Added a test for the undo manager's ability to set the "modified since
  save" flag.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1631 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Refactored interpreterResetFailed so different messages could be
   printed in different subclasses of InteractionsModel (eg. Eclipse plug-in)

 - Removed redundant method contracts from GlobalModelListener.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1633 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1635 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1637 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1639 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Updating Eclipse plug-in to 0.9.1.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1640 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added support for cycling between the current definitions pane and all
  of the tabs.

- Refactored the Compiler, JUnit, and Javadoc caret listeners into one. This
  also fixed some highlighting issues with certain errors not being highlighted
  when mulitple types of errors were on one line of source code.

- Hoisted the ChangeListener for the highlight checkboxes in the three error
  panels into the ErrorPanel superclass. This fixed a bug where the highlights
  sometimes would not be updated correctly when the user toggled the
  "Highlight source" checkbox.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1641 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed a bug where closing the debugger did not remove all of the debug
  interpreters, and we were trying to add debug interpreters that were
  already there.

- Changed the default keybinding on run to F2 from F6 since F6 is
  used in Swing to change splitpane focus.

- Watches will now be highlighted in bold after changing values.

- Stepping will no longer switch to the next suspended thread.

- By turning on the debugger, the user can now watch variables defined in
  the default interpreter.

- Tooltips were added to some menu items which did not have them before.

- Added the config option of showing the debug console menu item in the
  Tools menu. Those wanting to debug DrJava with it should add the line
  "show.debug.console = true" to their .drjava files outside of DrJava.

- null instanceof Object used to throw NullPointerException. It now
  returns false like conventional Java.

- mainFrame, model, and config are declared final in the debug console
  so that they can be used within inner classes.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1643 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed bug #781161 "Breakpoints Tree Misaligned". If an enclosing
  top-level class cannot be found when setting a breakpoint, the class
  name of the breakpoint will be assigned to the first class or
  interface definition in the file. Also, we now check for null when
  getting the path of a tree node.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1645 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- fixed the attempt to load tools.jar to be case insensitive on windows.

- made InputStreamRedirector's read() methods synchronized, like real System.in (I
  think).  Anyway, it produces better behavior, since _getInput() won't be called
  excess times if two threads want input from System.in simultaneously.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1647 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- added a different mode of console input--DrScheme-like box in the
  interactions pane.  Currently disabled, since it might be a little
  buggy.

- hoisted some code from the interactions controller to the abstract
  console controller superclass.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1649 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Renamed "Javadoc Current Document" to "Preview Javadoc for Current
   Document" to reflect that it isn't saved.  (See bug 779805.)

 - Updated documentation to reflect "Preview Javadoc", and also added some
   common browser commands in the Configuration chapter.

 - The home key now has two-stage ("intelligent") behavior, where it will
   go to the first non-whitespace character on the line if the caret is to
   the right of that character; otherwise it will go to the start of the
   line.  (Added a getIntelligentBeginLinePos method on
   DefinitionsDocument and a corresponding test on IndentHelperTest.)

 - Modified KeyBindingManager to allow adding custom shift actions.

 - Refined the new System.in box and enabled it by default.

 - Fixed a bug for the Interactions Pane font on OS X 1.4.1 where
   shift+enter would revert back to the default font.

 - Added several tool tips to MainFrame menu items.

 - The UncaughtExceptionWindow now prints out the containedThrowable of
   any UnexpectedExceptions.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1650 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Reformatting eclipse.sh to make it more legible.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1653 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed bug #782963, "DrJava can save over read-only files". Added a check
  is the file is read-only before trying to save it. Also cleans up temp files
  if the save fails.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1654 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Changes:
    - Added ProgressMonitor parameter to indent logic, currently unused
    - Overrided "undo" on CompoundEditManager to allow aborting a CompoundEdit
        -- this may not actually work and needs tests
    - Added new parameter to getFirstNonWSChar in DefDoc to include/ignore
        comments
    - Added new indent rules to add text and move the current position
    - Added tests for the simple version of the new rules 
        -- need more tests for the complex multi-line version
    - Changed the indent rule logic to specify whether the current position has
        moved
    - Added new config option to auto-close comments
    - Changed the indent tree to auto-close comments, if the option == true
    - Created new ForegroundColorListener and BackgroundColorListener to update
        colors
    - Used above for all display elements on MainFrame (but not dialogs)
        -- needs tests
    - Added custom font and color support for line numbers
    - Window and doc list sizes are now saved and restored.  Vestigial support
         for saving and restoring tabbed pane size.  No position saving yet.
    - Fixed race condition in NewJVMTest that was interfering with commits
         on Windows.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1656 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Fixed a bug with my last commit where you could not save a new file.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1658 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Addressed bug #782103, an UnexpectedException while getting the
  debug interpreter. We explicitly tell arguments to remote methods
  to disable their collection and then re-enable it after the call.

- Changed DebugThreadData so that getting the name of a thread
  after the VirtualMachine has disconnected will not blow up.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1660 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- added a file filter to the tools.jar selection file chooser so that it
  only displays jar files.

- split debug test in half.  Half is now in DebugTest and the other half
  is in DebugContextTest.

- fixed a bug where the save _button_ was updated on an undo/redo rather
  than the save _action_.  A reference to the save button is no longer
  kept, to avoid possible confusion.

- fixed some coloring issues with System.in.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1671 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- fixed a bug with the new file filter in DrJava.  It now correctly shows
  .jar files and directories only.

- modified histories so that an end-of-interaction token is added after
  every interaction in the history.

- added the ability to load a history "as a script," i.e. replay the
  history one interaction at a time, through a new button panel on the
  right of the interactions tab.

- added an option to change the debug/error messages color in the
  interactions pane.

- added a (currently disabled) feature to allow custom compilers to be
  used.  OptionConstants.EXTRA_COMPILERS is referenced by CompilerRegistry
  to check for extra compiler classnames.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1696 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Committing the stable build for a stable release.

 - Changed the interaction separator comment for histories from
   "//EOI//" to "//End of Interaction//" to be clearer for users.

 - Added tooltips to the interactions script buttons.

 - Fixed a bug with next/previous in interactions scripts.
   Before, clicking Previous after an execution would skip over the most
   recent interaction, which was counter-intuitive and inconsistent
   with the traditional history.  Also, Previous was not enabled after
   the first execution.  This was corrected by including a state to
   remember if we have "passed" the current interaction by executing it.
   The test for this behavior is in InteractionsModelTest.

 - Updated Javadoc comments in several places.

 - Made the event notifier in the debugger final, like most even notifiers.

 - Made the ScrollableDialogs larger by default.

 - Edited the tooltip for close-block-comments.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1705 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

I should have submitted the following two comments for my previous commit on 20030829.

- Fixed bug #797515, "No default initialization of variables".
  Changed the grammar to reject multiple access modifiers.

- Fixed bug #787625, "Tools.jar not found".
  DrJava now displays an error dialog if the location of tools.jar could not be saved.

These are the real comments for this commit.

- Fixed bug #802924 "default OS X font is too light".
  OptionConstants now checks to see if Mac14Platform is being used when setting default fonts.

- Fixed unsubmitted bug where if the interpreter JVM is reset while DrJava is awaiting input
  from System.in, future calls to System.in will freeze the interpreter JVM until DrJava is
  totally restarted.

- Fixed bug #803304 "Uncomment lines wont rebind".
  Certain actions were being added to the KeyBindingManager too many times,
  causing their values to always return to their default values.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1732 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added an errorStartingSlave method to MasterRemote, which
   SlaveJVMRunner can call if something goes wrong while trying to
   instantiate the slave JVM.  This allows the master JVM to provide
   better diagnostic information on the error.

 - Improved the error handling in SlaveJVMRunner to help diagnose some of
   the recent bug reports.  Enable the SHOW_DEBUG_DIALOGS flag to provide
   additional Swing dialogs if the slave is unable to register with the
   master.  These are usually disabled because they frequently open during
   tests, when the master might disappear before the slave registers.

 - Moved BorderlessScrollPane, BorderlessSplitPane, and ScrollableDialog
   from DrJava to the util/swing package, since they're pretty generic.
   DrJavaScrollableDialog takes over the responsibility of setting the
   font of its text area to DrJava's default font.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1734 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Implemented the new errorStartingSlave method in MainJVM, allowing
   DrJava to display an UncaughtExceptionWindow if an error occurs while
   starting the slave JVM.  (Provides better diagnostic info.)

 - MainJVM is no longer _enabled if slaveQuitDuringStartup is called.

 - Removed the redundant call to resetInteractionsClasspath() in
   DefaultGlobalModel's constructor.

 - Moved ScrollableDialog, BorderlessScrollPane, and BorderlessSplitPane
   to the util/swing package, since they're pretty generic.  The new
   DrJavaScrollableDialog class takes over the responsibility of setting
   the font of its text area to DrJava's default font.

- Changed the default Javadoc arguments to "-author -version", so that
   @author and @version tags are displayed in the source by default, if
   they are specified.

 - Fixed tests to run on OS X.  GlobalModelIOTest, GlobalModelOtherTest,
   and SingleDisplayModelTest all compared files in /tmp, but on OS X, the
   actual location is /private/tmp.  These comparisons were changed to use
   getCanonicalFile().

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1754 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Reverted to behavior where the Interactions Pane is reset after compiling
  even if it has not been used.  Users could easily and unknowingly be
  interacting with unexpected same-named class files.

- Caught some more instances of VMDisconnectedException that can occur when
  shutting down the debugger.

- Fixed bug #854535. "new 2d array throws IllegalArgumentException".
  This required fixing a bug in DynamicJava's ArrayAllocation class.

- The default working directory is now set to the user's home directory
  instead of the directory DrJava was launched from.

- Added a configuration option to allow access to private and protected
  members of classes in the Interactions Pane.
  When using the debugger, because of some class loader issues, in some
  cases you may still get IllegalArgumentExceptions when accessing class
  members.

- Added support for the prototype JSR14v2.3 and 2.4 compilers.  These have
  not yet been publicly released.

  changes were not compatible with JSR14v1.0 which we need to use to release.

  update the "Allow access to private members" configuration option without
  having to reset the Interactions Pane.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1793 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Prevented DynamicJavaAdapter from creating the config framework
   in the Interpreter JVM (which was extra overhead and caused the
   SlaveJVMRunner icon to appear on Mac OS X after every reset).
   MainJVM now sets whether private members should be accessible after
   each reset.  This fixes bug #896937 ("SlaveJVMRunner in foreground
   after launch").

 - Moved the option listener for ALLOW_PRIVATE_ACCESS from MainFrame to
   DefaultGlobalModel.

 - Added warning comments to (hopefully) each of the classes created in
   the Interpreter JVM, not to create the config framework.

 - Updated the developer documentation with instructions on how to update
   the user/developer documentation, along with a warning about not using
   the config framework in the Interpreter JVM.  It is now officially
   open season for adding useful tips to the dev docs.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1811 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Added an option to add command-line JVM arguments to the interpreter.  These
  arguments are parsed in the same way as arguments to a main method call.

- Split GlobalModelCompileSuccessTest into two sub-tests, since the single test
  case was causing an OutOfMemoryError to be thrown during compilation.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1812 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- fixed a bug with the new file filter in DrJava.  It now correctly shows
  .jar files and directories only.

- modified histories so that an end-of-interaction token is added after
  every interaction in the history.

- added the ability to load a history "as a script," i.e. replay the
  history one interaction at a time, through a new button panel on the
  right of the interactions tab.

- added an option to change the debug/error messages color in the
  interactions pane.

- added a (currently disabled) feature to allow custom compilers to be
  used.  OptionConstants.EXTRA_COMPILERS is referenced by CompilerRegistry
  to check for extra compiler classnames.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1814 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- (added) and fixed a feature where interactions that are incomplete will not be
interpreted when the user types enter.  Instead, the caret will be moved on to
the next line and the user given a new prompt.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1816 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed bug #915906 "Methods in Interactions no longer work."
  Removed all typechecking of method declarations.

- Fixed bug #905405 "Undo Alt+Anything Causes Exception."
  processKeyEvent ignores Alt+Anything keystrokes although
  menu shortcuts still work.

- Fixed bug #900840 "Help files missing."
  Changed build.xml to make docbook2html output html files with
  the names of the sections instead of gibberish.

- Changed the test dialog messages to be (in my opinion) more readable.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@1818 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Fixed bug #907211 "Test Failures Not Cleared Properly."
  The tests were only being cleared on a call to
  Test Current Document.

- Fixed bug #917054 "Interactions Reset Bug."
  We now notify the lock on the input box upon
  interpreter ready instead of earlier on
  interpreter resetting.

Added unit test to DynamicJavaTest that checks to see if primitives can be autoboxed in contexts requiring a more general type that the wrapper class type corresponding to the primtive.  This test fails in previous commit.  Revised AbstractTypeChecker to handle the case where the context has Object type.  This is not a general solution.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@2190 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

I revised the code in AbstractTypeChecker to support autoboxing the right hand side of a variable definition when the it is a primitive constant and the left hand side is a supertype of the wrapper type corresponding to the constant.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@2192 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

I updated AbstractTypeChecker to support autoboxing in any variable declaration
<var> = <expr> where <expr> is a primitive constant and the type of <var> is a supertype of the wrapper class type corresponding to <expr>.  I also added two
unit tests to DynamicJavaTest to test this behavior. More unit test should be added.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@2194 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added synchronization to DefaultGlobalModel and DefaultCompilerModel.  DefaultJUnitModel does not appear to require synchronization since it appears that all invocations are encapsulated with methods in DefaultGlobalModel (which are synchronized).  Perhaps the code should be refactored to impose the same discipline on invoking methods in DefaultCompilerModel.  I also performed some minor stylistic refactorings recommended by findbugs.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@2916 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

----------------------------------------------------------------------
dynamicjava.jar CVS:
----------------------------------------------------------------------
This dynamicjava.jar is identical to the previously committed version
except for the fact that it was compiled with "target=jsr14" instead
of "target=1.5".  The former is compatible with Java 1.4 while the
latter is not.  Unfortunatley, there is a unit test in DynamicJava
(testBridgeMethodLookup in koala.dynamicjava.util.ReflectionUtilitiesTest)
that looks for a "BRIDGE" attribute in class files that is only
supported by "target=1.5".  We need to either rewrite this unit test
or specially compile the code for this unit test using "target=1.5"
so that it succeeds.  Since the unit test code is not included in the
jar, it does not matter if the code for that specific test is not
1.4 compatible.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@2954 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Implemented the project classpath feature. Project-specific classpath elements are read from the classpath directive in the project file, but are no longer propagated to the EXTRA_CLASSPATH global setting. Instead, this section of the project file corresponds solely with the project classpath. Preexisting project files will have entries that used to correspond to the EXTRA_SETTINGS option, but removing them will actually keep them from coming back now.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3020 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Fix all Javadoc warnings outside of koala. As an aside, all @link tags in package.html files need to be fully qualified, i.e. including the package name. Also, to link to methods in the same class, the notation is #method(type1, type2); the octothorpe (#) needs to be present. Likewise when linking to methods outside the class: packagename.outerclass.innerclass#method(type1, type2) would be the generic form; package name can supposedly be ommitted if it is imported in the file, but in practice this seems to fail, so qualify things outside the current file. This commit also replaces all occurences of new Boolean(), only one of these was explicit, but "return true" in methods that return Boolean seems to implicitly call the Boolean constructor, which is wasteful since there can be only one (I mean two). Also cleaned up all usages of != and == testing for String equality, and replaced the 50+ lines of individual copy statements in build.xml with a single copy statement matching *.jpg when copying the quickstart docs.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3024 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Cleaned up build-common.xml.15:
 - jsr14.jar is now excluded from the classpath, as long as it's not in the CLASSPATH environment variable.
   It will not be added at build time by ant. Likewise for collect.jar, if it exists in the lib directory.
 - Javadoc generation no longer copies the entire source tree to a temporary folder, this seems to have been
   intended for generation of javadocs with JSR14, and I think even the later versions of JSR14 didn't need
   to strip generics out for javadoc creation. At any rate, J2SE 5.0 certainly does not need this.
 - The do-compile and checked-compile targets used to put jsr14.jar on the bootclasspath. I don't think this is
   necessary (-J-Xbootclasspath/p:jsr14.jar certainly is NOT necessary), but this may be the one part that I
   might end up rolling back if it causes problems.

NOTE: this is a work in progress. This is simply a cleaned-up build-common.xml. I think the real solution
   is going to involve moving things into a single, top-level build.xml and including platform-specific
   XML files, like the Eclipse project does for their build system, only not quite as convoluted or
   confusing (that's the DrJava way, after all).

Added a field to ClassFileError to record the class name in addition to the source file since multiple class can be embedded in a source file.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3045 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

The interactions now resets itself when the project closes rather than displaying the warning message in the interactions pane.  The key binding SHIFT+F3 now maps to search backwards (or rather in reverse direction).  The Auxiliary bin is renamed to "Included External Files" and the action to move an external to aux is now something like "Include with project" rather than "Move to Auxiliary". Pluss the tooltip on that menu item gives a description of aux files. I updated the user documentation to match these changes as well.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3046 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Changed the way the close file warning works.  It now warns about closing a project file before the project is saved.  Also changed the Lift Interactions Pane action.  It now lifts the current line or if the current line is empty it will lift the most recent entry from the history.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3048 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Resets the interactions pane when project is opened. This also causes a reset of the interactions pane when opening up a project while another project is already open.  This fixes some bugs with the debugger remaining active across project sessions.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3050 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Added varargs interpretation to dynamicjava


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3052 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Removed hourglassOn/hourglassOff bracketing around running JUnit tests; it inhibited the use of the debugger and created deadlocks i the debugger was run.  Added hourglassOn/hourglassOff bracketing to the preparation phase of JUnit testing so that the user gets a visible response when testing multiple files.  Eliminated the compile/test open project files command since there was no distinction in the compilation case and unhelpful variation in the testing case.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3053 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Close some findbugs-found-bugs.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3055 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Knock about 7 minutes off of the time it takes for a full pass of unit testing, by removing all explicit calls to System.gc(). Also, make sure to put the project's extra classpath on the compiler's classpath so that you can save per-project compilation entries in the pjt file. Also fixed a number of other minor findbugs-found bugs.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3057 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

When unit testing, any actions in the menus or buttons that could adversly affect the junit process are dissabled so that the hourglass doesn't need to beayed throughout the testing.  This enables users to work with the debugger when a test is in progress without letting them do anything to modify the class files.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3059 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Revised comment and line break formatting; no changes to code.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3061 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

All features except VariableArguments now works in the InteractionsPane when you are using the Jsr14 v.2.4 compiler. I have not found out why it creates the mismatching arguments when you try to use varargs when the jsr14 is enabled. It should not be any different than using java 1.5. We translate the varargs into an arraytype. For now, due to the release coming up, I have put in a check for it in TypeChecker15, to give the user a message that VarArgs is currently not supported in anything else than java 1.5 or higher. This check will be removed when I have located the problem.

For each modified file, the user is asked whether or not to save it, but no cancellation is possible.  Unit tests now run much faster on my laptop--nearly as fast as before I started inserting lots of sychronization and invokeLater/invokeAndWait calls but I think this is due more to some configuration issues on my laptop than it is to the new code.

In CommandLineTest, two tests were using the same directory name for creating a temporary file system, which seems problematic in the context of concurrent execution of tests.  In MainFrameTest, many GUI operations are done by the main thread when they are supposed to be performed by the event thread.  I moved some of these to the event thread.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3127 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

This may cure a bug in findReplace where the current DefinitionsPane is not updated to reflect the correct contents of the document after replace/findNext replaces the current match and fails to find another match.  The bug is a timing bug because it only happens intermittently.

Moved the selection of the designated error in the ErrorListPanel to the end of _switchToError in ErrorPanel.java.  This change fixes a bug where the selected error does not advance if the next error has the same position in the file as the preceding one.  _switchToError invokes definions document/pane primitives that reselect the error in the ErrorLIstPanel corresponding to the caret position in the file; this process can change the error selection if multiple errors correspond to the same position in the file.

Reversed two recent "improvements" to the code because they appear to producing unit test failures and other problems.  The two changes were using invokeAndWait instead of invokeLater in the activeDocumentChanged method in the GlobalModelListener in MainFrame and optimizing setActiveDocument in DefaultSingleDisplayModel by immediately returning if the new active document is the same as the current one.  Both of these changes are now reversed.

Fixed a few bugs that were added into Find/Replace and fixed a long-standing bug that messed up the focus-switching in the Find/Replace Dialog when Replace All button was not active (i.e. when the _findField was blank).

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3344 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

-Moved all Find/Replace logic to the model package and removed it from the util packge.

-Changed ignoring of comments/strings in Find/Replace to use the reduced model

-Added AbstractGlobalModel, an implementation of SingleDisplayModel without the following features: compilation, testing, jarring, interactions, javadoc, or debugger. Used for testing Find/Replace, but could possibly be used as a lightweight alternative for other tests (maybe even features)

-Abstracted out findNext and findPrevious for the purposes of correctly implementing F3 (find next) and Shift-F3 (find previous)

-Added an hourglass to commenting/uncommenting

-Made open/save file selection boxes larger

-When there are only warnings found after compilation, the compilerModel no longer switches to the warning. It just displays the warnings found to the user

-Fixed a bug in indentation that, when the caret was before a space (for example, between words), the caret would move to the end of the space

-When attempting to use a feature that requires a tabbed pane (compilation, tesing, etc), and the tabbed pane is minimized, it now unminimizes the relevant tabbed pane, which wasn't done before. Also applicable to switching between documents when the documents pane is minimized.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3346 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

-Moved all Find/Replace logic to the model package and removed it from the util packge.

-Changed ignoring of comments/strings in Find/Replace to use the reduced model

-Added AbstractGlobalModel, an implementation of SingleDisplayModel without the following features: compilation, testing, jarring, interactions, javadoc, or debugger. Used for testing Find/Replace, but could possibly be used as a lightweight alternative for other tests (maybe even features)

-Abstracted out findNext and findPrevious for the purposes of correctly implementing F3 (find next) and Shift-F3 (find previous)

-Added an hourglass to commenting/uncommenting

-Made open/save file selection boxes larger

-When there are only warnings found after compilation, the compilerModel no longer switches to the warning. It just displays the warnings found to the user

-Fixed a bug in indentation that, when the caret was before a space (for example, between words), the caret would move to the end of the space

-When attempting to use a feature that requires a tabbed pane (compilation, tesing, etc), and the tabbed pane is minimized, it now unminimizes the relevant tabbed pane, which wasn't done before. Also applicable to switching between documents when the documents pane is minimized.

The working directory is used as the user.dir for the interactions pane.[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[D[Dno[2~w used as [C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C  Fixed a bug in the unit testing of language levels documents.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3516 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Remove "Console input: " prefix preceding echoed console input in the interactions pane.  Restored the dark magenta highlight color for echoed console input int both the console pane and the interactions pane.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3518 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

When the interactions pane is reset, the working directory is set to a
plausible location.  If a project is open, then working directory is
the declared working diretory of the project if one exists; otherwise
it is the sourceroot for the project.  If no project is open, the
working directory is the source root for one of the open files (they
should all have the same root) provided WORKING_DIRECTORY is not set
in the DrJava profile.  In flat file mode when WORKING_DIRECTORY is
set in the DrJava preferences, the working directory for the
interactions pane is the specified directory.

When the interactions pane is reset, a banner giving the working
directory for the new interpreter appears at the top of the pane.

I also changed all names of the form "classpath" to "classPath" and
names of the form "Classpath" to "ClassPath".  In the previous code
base, there was no consistency concerning capitalizing "Path" in
"classPath" or "ClassPath".  I also eliminated IGetDocuments in favor
of GlobalModel (which has many more methods) which forced the renaming
of several classes concerning the IGetDocuments interface.  There is
now a DummyGlobalModel class in which all methods from GlobalModel throw
UnsupportedOperation exceptions.

Optimized resetInteractions so that it suppresses killing and restarting the slave JVM when (i) the slave JVM has not been used (to interpret interactions or run JUnit tests) and (ii) the requested working directory matches the working directory (user.dir) of the existing slave JVM.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3574 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Fixed and improved "Create Jar from Project" dialog:
1) The project's main class is entered as
default value for the jar's main class.
2) We provide a treeview dialog like the "Select
Main Class" dialog in "Project Properties".
3) The dialog "Jar Creation Successful" had "OK" and
"Cancel" buttons. The "Cancel" button was be
removed. Instead, there now is a "Run" button if the
jar file was made executable.
4) There is a label next to the "main class"
textfield describing its purpose.
5) There is a better explanation why classes sometimes
cannot be jar-ed.
6) There is better progress indication, you cannot
click "OK" several times and concurrently build the
jar file.
7) Settings are saved in the project file.
8) Location is saved in the DrJava properties.

Added more unit tests for PredictiveInputModel.

Fixed unit test that was breaking because of incorrect
string matching.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3729 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

(1) Fixed a bug in the paths displayed for files in the navigation pane;
the paths were relative to the project file parent rather than the project
root.  They are now relative to the project root
(2) Added support for a "Save Project As ..." command.  Only a new project file is saved; the source tree is not moved or copied.
(3)  Changed the format of project (.pjt) files to store paths for the files 
in the source tree relative to the source root rather than the project file 
parent.  The old file format is still supported.  The two formats are distinguished by the name of the property given the project root.  It is "proj-root" in the old format and "proj-root-and-base" in the new format.  In the new format, this property is mandatory in every project file.


git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3730 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Fixed "shifting breakpoint highlight" bug:
- Position objects are wrapped in WrappedPositions.
- A DefinitionsDocument remembers all WrappedPositions it creates
  using a LinkedList of WeakReferences.
- When a document is kicked out of the cache, the DDReconstructor
  stores the WrappedPositions and their current indices in a
  WeakHashMap.
- When a document is restored, the DDReconstructor re-creates
  the Position objects and updates all WrappedPositions.

Added "Scan Class Files after Each Compile" option:
- This allows auto-completion even of inner class names.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3754 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

- Breakpoints set on lines that are not executable are now not set at all
  (if the lines are empty or the class has already been loaded into the
  debugger), or they are set but later disabled (if the debugger is not
  active or the class has not been loaded yet)

- Code to determine the actual class name, given the offset in a document,
  has been added. This includes all top-level, nested, inner, and anonymous
  inner classes. The package name is prefixed. Class names are separated
  by $. Example: edu.rice.cs.drjava.DrJava$NestedClass$1$2

* Known bug: initializer blocks throw getEnclosingClassName off:
  class Foo { { /* initializer block */ }

- Fixed a bug in findPrevNonWSCharPos. It was scanning for the end of a
  comment, but it had to scan for the "reverse" of the beginning of a
  comment.

- Code to find the opening and closing brace (any type) has been added.
  User can go to opening/closing brace {} by using Ctrl-Shift-[].

- Beginning of lightweight parsing: User can enable/disable parsing
  in Preferences/Miscellaneous and set a delay. Parsing will begin only
  after the delay has passed after the last keystroke.

- Currently, the only lightweight parsing being done is determining the
  actual class the cursor is in (using getEnclosingClassName). This is
  more a test of how lightweight parsing could be integrated.

- I have noticed that the _currentLocation in an AbstractDJDocument
  is usually off -- it's not equal to the view's caret position. This is
  because it is not being reset in AbstractDJDocument.getHighlightStatus
  for speed reasons (see comment there). I have added a method
  getCaretPosition() to OpenDefinitionsDocument. The concrete implementations
  buffer this value.

- Fixed a bug with cached class files: When files are compiled or the
  build directory is cleared, the cached values for the class files were
  not cleared. The result was an out-of-sync document even though it was
  freshly compiled.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3755 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

Fixes several important bugs including:

(i) Poor performance bug in loading large projects.  Every document in
a project was being parsed at project load time to extract its package name.
The new version gets the package names for project source files from
the project file, eliminating the need to read every file in the
project at load time.

(ii) Unit testing behaved erratically in the presence of modified
source files, out-of-sync class files, and open non-source files.  In
the last case, it would not run at all.  The "automatically compile
before testing" option failed most of the time and the combination of
"always save before compiling" and "automatically compile before
testing" failed in several different ways.  The new version ignores
non-source files and supports any combination of "always save before
compiling" and "automatically compile before testing" that the user
requests.  When files are automatically compiled before testing, the
slave JVM is not restarted (restarting is wasteful and could cause
synchronization problems since the slave JVM actually runs the unit
tests).

(iii) The unit tests for unit testing support (GlobalModelJUnitTest)
and for project support (ProjectMenuTest) were flawed.
GlobalModelJUnitTest did not check for the right behavior when testing
out of sync classfiles or modified source files.  ProjectMenuTest did
not properly check the handling of auxiliary project files.

git-svn-id: file:///tmp/test-svn/trunk@3759 fe72c1cf-3628-48e9-8b72-1c46755d3cff

This commit fixes two bugs:
[ 1467537 ] NullPointerException After Close All Files/Open Folder
[ 1466590 ] Cancel in "Save?" Dialogs on Quit
The first bug was caused by File.listFiles returning null in case
of an IO error. I looked for every use of File.listFiles and inserted
a check for null.
The second bug was mainly handled by doing a round of canAbandonFile
calls that take care of saving and possibly cancelling. Only if all
files were processed that way, all files were closed.

The commit also removes the uses of getEnclosingClassName, which
unfortunately is incorrect and slow.
